<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage136"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W1_HTM_134">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 18PT">
<B>
	SCHEDULE &#147;A&#148;
<BR>
	GOLDCORP INC.
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	AUDIT COMMITTEE CHARTER
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	I. PURPOSE
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Audit Committee (&#147;Audit Committee&#148; or &#147;Committee&#148;) is a committee of the Board of
	Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;) of Goldcorp Inc. (&#147;Goldcorp&#148; or the &#147;Company&#148;). The primary function
	of the Audit Committee is to assist the Board in fulfilling its financial reporting and
	controls responsibilities to the shareholders of the Company and the investment community.
	The external auditors will report directly to the Audit Committee. The Audit Committee&#146;s
	primary duties and responsibilities are:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	A.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	overseeing the integrity of the Company&#146;s financial statements and reviewing
	the financial reports and other financial information provided by the Company to any
	governmental body or the public and other relevant documents;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	B.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	assisting the Board in oversight of the Company&#146;s compliance with legal and
	regulatory requirements;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	C.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	recommending the appointment and reviewing and appraising the audit efforts of
	the Company&#146;s independent auditor, overseeing the non-audit services provided by the
	independent auditor, overseeing the independent auditor&#146;s qualifications and
	independence and providing an open avenue of communication among the independent
	auditor, financial and senior management and the Board of Directors;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	D.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	assisting the Board in oversight of the performance of the Company&#146;s internal
	audit function;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	E.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	serving as an independent and objective party to oversee and monitor the
	Company&#146;s financial reporting process and internal controls, the Company&#146;s processes to
	manage business and financial risk, and its compliance with legal, ethical and
	regulatory requirements;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	F.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	preparing Audit Committee report(s) as required by applicable regulators; and
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	G.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	encouraging continuous improvement of, and fostering adherence to, the
	Company&#146;s policies, procedures and practices at all levels.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	II. COMPOSITION AND OPERATIONS
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	A.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	The Committee shall operate under the guidelines applicable to all Board
	committees, which are located in item 31(vii) of Tab A-6, Board Guidelines.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	B.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	The Audit Committee shall be comprised of at least three directors, all of whom
	are &#147;independent&#148; as such term is defined in the Board Guidelines (Tab A-6).
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	C.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	In addition, unless otherwise authorized by the Board, no director shall be
	qualified to be a member of the Audit Committee if such director (i)&nbsp;is an &#147;affiliated
	person&#148;, as defined in Appendix&nbsp;One, or (ii)&nbsp;receives (or his/her immediate family
	member or the entity for which such director is a director, member, partner or
	principal and which provides consulting, legal, investment banking, financial or other
	similar services to the Company), directly or indirectly, any consulting, advisory, or
	other compensation from the Company other than compensation for serving in his or her
	capacity as member of the Board and as a member of Board committees.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	A-1
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage137"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	D.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	All members shall, to the satisfaction of the Board of Directors, be
	&#147;financially literate&#148; as defined in Appendix&nbsp;One, and at least one member shall have
	accounting or related financial management expertise to qualify as a &#147;financial expert&#148;
	as defined in Appendix&nbsp;One.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	E.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	If a Committee member simultaneously serves on the audit committees of more
	than three public companies, the Committee shall seek the Board&#146;s determination as to
	whether such simultaneous service would impair the ability of such member to
	effectively serve on the Company&#146;s audit committee and ensure that such determination
	is disclosed.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	F.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	The Committee shall meet at least four times annually, or more frequently as
	circumstances require. The Committee shall meet within 45&nbsp;days following the end of
	each of the first three financial quarters to review and discuss the unaudited
	financial results for the preceding quarter and the related MD&#038;A and shall meet within
	90&nbsp;days following the end of the fiscal year end to review and discuss the audited
	financial results for the year and related MD&#038;A prior to their publishing.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	G.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	The Committee may ask members of management or others to attend meetings and
	provide pertinent information as necessary. For purposes of performing their audit
	related duties, members of the Committee shall have full access to all corporate
	information and shall be permitted to discuss such information and any other matters
	relating to the financial position of the Company with senior employees, officers and
	independent auditors of the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	H.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	As part of its job to foster open communication, the Committee should meet at
	least annually with management and the independent auditor in separate executive
	sessions to discuss any matters that the Committee or each of these groups believe
	should be discussed privately. In addition, the Committee or at least its Chair should
	meet with the independent auditor and management quarterly to review the Company&#146;s
	financial statements.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	I.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Each of the Chairman of the Committee, members of the Committee, Chairman of
	the Board, independent auditors, Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer or
	Secretary shall be entitled to request that the Chairman of the Audit Committee call a
	meeting which shall be held within 48 hours of receipt of such request.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	III. RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To fulfill its responsibilities and duties the Audit Committee shall:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	A.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Create an agenda for the ensuing year.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	B.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review and update this Charter at least annually, as conditions dictate.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	C.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Describe briefly in the Company&#146;s annual report and more fully in the Company&#146;s
	Management Information Circular the Committee&#146;s composition and responsibilities and
	how they were discharged.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	-A2-
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage138"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	D.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Documents/Reports Review
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review with management and the independent auditors, the
	Company&#146;s interim and annual financial statements, management discussion and
	analysis, earnings releases and any reports or other financial information to
	be submitted to any governmental and/or regulatory body, or the public,
	including any certification, report, opinion, or review rendered by the
	independent auditor for the purpose of recommending their approval to the Board
	prior to their filing, issue or publication. The Chair of the Committee may
	represent the entire Committee for purposes of this review in circumstances
	where time does not allow the full Committee to be available.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review analyses prepared by management and/or the independent
	auditor setting forth significant financial reporting issues and judgments made
	in connection with the preparation of the financial statements, including
	analyses of the effects of alternative GAAP methods on the financial
	statements.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review the effect of regulatory and accounting initiatives, as
	well as off balance sheet structures, on the financial statements of the
	Company.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iv)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review policies and procedures with respect to directors&#146; and
	officers&#146; expense accounts and management perquisites and benefits, including
	their use of corporate assets and expenditures related to executive travel and
	entertainment, and review the results of the procedures performed in these
	areas by the independent auditor, based on terms of reference agreed upon by
	the independent auditor and the Audit Committee.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	v)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review expenses of the Non-Executive Board Chair and CEO
	quarterly.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	vi)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Ensure that adequate procedures are in place for the review of
	the Company&#146;s public disclosure of financial information extracted or derived
	from the issuer&#146;s financial statements, as well as review any financial
	information and earnings guidance provided to analysts and rating agencies, and
	periodically assess the adequacy of those procedures.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	E.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Independent Auditor
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Recommend to the Board and approve the selection of the
	independent auditor, consider the independence and effectiveness and approve
	the fees and other compensation to be paid to the independent auditor.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Monitor the relationship between management and the independent
	auditor including reviewing any management letters or other reports of the
	independent auditor and discussing any material differences of opinion between
	management and the independent auditor.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review and discuss, on an annual basis, with the independent
	auditor all significant relationships they have with the Company to determine
	their independence and report to the Board of Directors.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iv)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review and approve requests for any non-audit services to be
	performed by the independent auditor and be advised of any other study
	undertaken at the request of management that is beyond the scope of the audit
	engagement letter and related fees. Pre-approval of non-audit services is
	satisfied if:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	The aggregate amount of non-audit services not
	pre-approved expected to constitute no more than 5% of total fees paid
	by issuer and subsidiaries to external auditor during fiscal year in
	which the services are provided;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	-A3-
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage139"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	the Company or a subsidiary did not recognize
	services as non-audit at the time of the engagement; and
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	the services are promptly brought to
	Committee&#146;s attention and approved prior to completion of the audit.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	v)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Ensure disclosure of any specific policies or procedures
	adopted by the Committee to satisfy pre-approval requirements for non-audit
	services by the Company&#146;s external auditor.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	vi)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review the relationship of non-audit fees to audit fees paid to
	the independent Auditor, to ensure that auditor independence is maintained.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	vii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Ensure that both the audit and non-audit fees are disclosed to
	shareholders by category.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	viii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review the performance of the independent auditor and approve
	any proposed discharge and replacement of the independent auditor when
	circumstances warrant. Consider with management and the independent auditor the
	rationale for employing accounting/auditing firms other than the principal
	independent auditor.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	ix)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	At least annually, consult with the independent auditor out of
	the presence of management about significant risks or exposures, internal
	controls and other steps that management has taken to control such risks, and
	the fullness and accuracy of the organization&#146;s financial statements.
	Particular emphasis should be given to the adequacy of internal controls to
	expose any payments, transactions, or procedures that might be deemed illegal
	or otherwise improper.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	x)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Arrange for the independent auditor to be available to the
	Audit Committee and the full Board as needed. Ensure that the auditors report
	directly to the Audit Committee and are made accountable to the Board and the
	Audit Committee, as representatives of the shareholders to whom the auditors
	are ultimately responsible.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	xi)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Oversee the work of the independent auditors engaged for the
	purpose of preparing or issuing an audit report or performing other audit,
	review or attest services.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	xii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Ensure that the independent auditors are prohibited from
	providing the following non-audit services and determining which other
	non-audit services the independent auditors are prohibited from providing:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	bookkeeping or other services related to the
	accounting records or financial statements of the Company;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	financial information systems design and
	implementation;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	appraisal or valuation services, fairness
	opinions, or contribution-in-kind reports;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	d)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	actuarial services;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	e)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	internal audit outsourcing services;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	f)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	management functions or human resources;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	g)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	broker or dealer, investment adviser or
	investment banking services;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	-A4-
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage140"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	h)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	legal services and expert services unrelated to
	the audit; and
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	any other services which the Public Company
	Accounting Oversight Board determines to be impermissible.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	xiii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Approve any permissible non-audit engagements of the
	independent auditors, in accordance with applicable legislation.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	F.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Internal Audit
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	The audit committee&#146;s understanding and approval of the annual
	internal audit plan;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Structuring the internal audit function to promote operational
	independence;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Establishing a direct line of communication between the head of
	internal audit and the audit committee;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iv)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Instituting appropriate communication and reporting lines
	between the internal auditors and management; and
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	v)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Holding regular meetings between the head of internal audit and
	the audit committee.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	G.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Financial Reporting Processes
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	In consultation with the independent auditor review the
	integrity of the organization&#146;s financial and accounting controls and reporting
	processes, both internal and external.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Consider the independent auditor&#146;s judgments about the quality
	and appropriateness, not just the acceptability, of the Company&#146;s accounting
	principles and financial disclosure practices, as applied in its financial
	reporting, particularly about the degree of aggressiveness or conservatism of
	its accounting principles and underlying estimates and whether those principles
	are common practices or are minority practices.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Consider and approve, if appropriate, major changes to the
	Company&#146;s accounting principles and practices as suggested by management with
	the concurrence of the independent auditor and ensure that the accountants&#146;
	reasoning is described in determining the appropriateness of changes in
	accounting principles and disclosure.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	H.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Process Improvement
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Discuss with independent auditors (i)&nbsp;the auditors&#146; internal
	quality-control procedures; and (ii)&nbsp;any material issues raised by the most
	recent internal quality-control review, or peer review, of the auditors, or by
	any inquiry of investigation by governmental or professional authorities,
	within the preceding five years, respecting one or more independent audits
	carried out by the auditors, and any steps taken to deal with any such issues.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Reviewing and approving hiring policies for employees or former
	employees of the past and present independent auditors.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Establish regular and separate systems of reporting to the
	Audit Committee by each of management and the independent auditor regarding any
	significant judgments made in management&#146;s preparation of the financial
	statements and the view of each as to appropriateness of such judgments.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	-A5-
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage141"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iv)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review the scope and plans of the independent auditor&#146;s audit
	and reviews prior to the audit and reviews being conducted. The Committee may
	authorize the independent auditor to perform supplemental reviews or audits as
	the Committee may deem desirable.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	v)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Following completion of the annual audit and quarterly reviews,
	review separately with each of management and the independent auditor any
	significant changes to planned procedures, any difficulties encountered during
	the course of the audit and reviews, including any restrictions on the scope of
	work or access to required information and the cooperation that the independent
	auditor received during the course of the audit and reviews.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	vi)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review any significant disagreements among management and the
	independent auditor in connection with the preparation of the financial
	statements.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	vii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Where there are significant unsettled issues the Committee
	shall ensure that there is an agreed course of action for the resolution of
	such matters.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	viii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review with the independent auditor and management significant
	findings during the year and the extent to which changes or improvements in
	financial or accounting practices, as approved by the Audit Committee, have
	been implemented. This review should be conducted at an appropriate time
	subsequent to implementation of changes or improvements, as decided by the
	Committee.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	ix)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review activities, organizational structure, and qualifications
	of the CFO and the staff in the financial reporting area and see to it that
	matters related to succession planning within the Company are raised for
	consideration at the full Board.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	I.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Ethical and Legal Compliance
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review management&#146;s monitoring of the Company&#146;s system in place
	to ensure that the Company&#146;s financial statements, reports and other financial
	information disseminated to governmental organizations, and the public satisfy
	legal requirements.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review, with the Company&#146;s counsel, legal and regulatory
	compliance matters, including corporate securities trading policies, and
	matters that could have a significant impact on the organization&#146;s financial
	statements.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review implementation of compliance with the Sarbanes-Oxley
	Act, Ontario Securities Commission requirements and other legal requirements.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iv)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Ensure that the CEO and CFO provide written certification with
	annual and interim financial statements and MD&#038;A and the Annual Information
	Form.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	J.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Risk Management
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Make inquires of management and the independent auditors to
	identify significant business, political, financial and control risks and
	exposures and assess the steps management has taken to minimize such risk to
	the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Ensure that the disclosure of the process followed by the Board
	and its committees, in the oversight of the Company&#146;s management of principal
	business risks, is complete and fairly presented.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Review management&#146;s program of risk assessment and steps taken
	to address significant risks or exposures, including insurance coverage.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	-A6-
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage142"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	K.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	General
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	i)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Conduct or authorize investigations into any matters within the
	Committee&#146;s scope of responsibilities. The Committee shall be empowered to
	retain independent counsel, accountants and other professionals to assist it in
	the conduct of any investigation.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Establish procedures for the receipt, retention and treatment
	of complaints received by the Company regarding accounting, internal accounting
	controls, or auditing matters; and the confidential, anonymous submission by
	employees of concerns regarding questionable accounting or auditing matters.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Ensure disclosure in the Annual Information Form if, at any
	time since the commencement of most recently completed financial year, the
	issuer has relied on any possible exemptions for Audit Committees.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iv)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Perform any other activities consistent with this Charter, the
	Company&#146;s Articles and By-laws and governing law, as the Committee or the Board
	deems necessary or appropriate.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	v)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Conduct a Committee annual self-evaluation and report to the
	Board of Directors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	IV. ACCOUNTABILITY
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	A.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	The Committee Chair has the responsibility to make periodic reports to the
	Board, as requested, on audit and financial matters relative to the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	B.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	The Committee shall report its discussions to the Board by maintaining minutes
	of its meetings and providing an oral report at the next Board meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	C.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	The minutes of the Audit Committee should be filed with the Corporate
	Secretary.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	-A7-
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>

<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">
<B>
	Exhibit&nbsp;99.2
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
	Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
	of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
	For the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2009
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">
<I>
	This Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis should be read in conjunction with Goldcorp&#146;s audited
	consolidated financial statements for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 and related notes thereto
	which have been prepared in accordance with Canadian generally accepted accounting principles
	(&#147;GAAP&#148;). This Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis contains forward-looking statements that are
	subject to risk factors set out in a cautionary note contained herein. All figures are in United
	States dollars unless otherwise noted. References to C$ are to Canadian dollars. This Management&#146;s
	Discussion and Analysis has been prepared as of March&nbsp;11, 2010.
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">

	2009 HIGHLIGHTS
</B>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="8%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company has included non-GAAP performance measures, total cash costs,
	by-product and co-product, per gold ounce, throughout this document. The Company
	reports total cash costs on a sales basis. In the gold mining industry, this is a
	common performance measure but does not have any standardized meaning. The Company
	follows the recommendations of the Gold Institute Production Cost Standard. The Company
	believes that, in addition to conventional measures prepared in accordance with GAAP,
	certain investors use this information to evaluate the Company&#146;s performance and
	ability to generate cash flow. Accordingly, it is intended to provide additional
	information and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures
	of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. Total cash costs on a by-product basis
	are calculated by deducting by-product copper and silver revenues from operating cash
	costs. Total cash costs on a co-product basis are calculated by allocating operating
	cash costs separately to metals using a ratio of revenues from metals as a proportion
	of total revenues. Total cash costs have been presented excluding San Martin, which
	commenced reclamation activities in October&nbsp;2007. Refer to page 42 for a reconciliation
	of total cash costs to reported operating expenses.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="8%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Adjusted net earnings and adjusted net earnings per share are non-GAAP
	performance measures. The Company believes that, in addition to conventional measures
	prepared in accordance with GAAP, the Company and certain investors use this
	information to evaluate the Company&#146;s performance. Accordingly, it is intended to
	provide additional information and should not be considered in isolation or as a
	substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. Refer to page
	43 for a reconciliation of adjusted net earnings to reported net earnings.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	the Company believes provides a better indicator of the Company&#146;s ability to generate
	cash flows from its mining operations.

<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 9PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage144"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	OVERVIEW
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Goldcorp Inc (&#147;Goldcorp&#148; or &#147;the Company&#148;) is a gold producer engaged in the operating,
	exploration, development and acquisition of precious metal properties in Canada, the United States,
	Mexico and Central and South America. The Company&#146;s current sources of operating cash flows are
	primarily from the sale of gold, copper and silver.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2009, the Company&#146;s producing mining properties are comprised of the Red Lake,
	Porcupine and Musselwhite gold mines in Canada; the San Dimas gold/silver and Los Filos and El
	Sauzal gold mines in Mexico; the Marlin gold/silver mine in Guatemala; the Alumbrera gold/copper
	mine (37.5% interest) in Argentina; and the Marigold (66.7% interest) and Wharf gold mines in the
	United States. Significant development projects include the Pe&#241;asquito gold/silver/zinc/lead and
	Noche Buena gold/silver projects in Mexico; the Cochenour, &#201;l&#233;onore and Hollinger gold projects in
	Canada; the Cerro Blanco gold/silver project in Guatemala; and the Pueblo Viejo gold project (40%
	interest) in the Dominican Republic. Goldcorp also owns a 65% interest in Terrane Metals Corp.
	(&#147;Terrane&#148;), a publicly traded company engaged in the development of the Mt. Milligan gold/copper
	project in Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Goldcorp is one of the world&#146;s lowest cost and fastest growing multi-million ounce gold producers
	with operations throughout the Americas. Goldcorp&#146;s strategy is to provide its shareholders with
	superior returns from high quality assets. Goldcorp has a strong and liquid balance sheet. Its gold
	production remains 100% unhedged.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Goldcorp is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (symbol: GG) and Toronto Stock Exchange (symbol:
	G). In addition, the Company has share purchase warrants which trade on the New York and Toronto
	Stock Exchanges.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	In response to the economic crisis which arose mid-2008, the strength of the US dollar declined
	during 2009 as investors sought financial security elsewhere. The commodities market, in particular
	gold, emerged as a strong haven for investors globally. Despite the more optimistic outlook on the
	economy during the second half of 2009, the strength of the US dollar continued to decline while
	gold prices reached record highs. During the fourth quarter of 2009 and the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2009, the Company realized an average gold price of $1,107 and $978 per ounce, respectively, a 39%
	and 13% increase from the fourth quarter of 2008 and the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008,
	respectively. Gold ounces sold during 2009 increased by 2% from 2008 due to higher production at
	most of the Company&#146;s mines, offset by lower production at Alumbrera and El Sauzal which was as
	planned. Costs of operations increased by 2% due to the higher sales volume, higher employee and
	consumable costs and higher export retention taxes, offset by the positive impact of the weakening
	of the Canadian dollar by 7% and the Mexican peso by 21% and lower YMAD net proceeds payments.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	On October&nbsp;13, 2009, the Company announced that the first lead and zinc concentrates were produced
	at its Pe&#241;asquito mine in Mexico. Throughout its mine life, Pe&#241;asquito will produce both lead and
	zinc concentrates, with most of the gold and silver production coming from the lead concentrates.
	Initial concentrates were produced as a by-product of the commissioning process. Concentrate
	shipment to smelters commenced and first sales were recorded in November&nbsp;2009.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	All components of the first sulphide process line (&#147;Line 1&#148;) at the Pe&#241;asquito mine are working as
	planned. Construction of the second sulphide process line (&#147;Line 2&#148;) remains on schedule for
	mechanical completion during the second quarter of 2010. The ramp-up of throughput rates to levels
	intended by management for Line 2 remains on track for the third quarter of 2010. The current
	capital estimate to mechanical completion is approximately 10% above the November&nbsp;2007 updated
	feasibility estimate of $1.49&nbsp;billion, excluding sustaining capital and pre-operating expenditures.
	Advancement of mine optimization evaluations has progressed and includes the assessment of an
	independent power plant and in-pit crushing and conveying.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	As Pe&#241;asquito reaches its planned critical milestones during 2010, the Company&#146;s focus will be to
	accelerate the development of its other high-quality growth projects. These projects include the
	advancement of Pueblo Viejo which remains on schedule for first gold in the fourth quarter of 2011,
	the access and development plan for Cochenour, construction of a deep winze (shaft)&nbsp;at Hoyle Pond
	to access new zones in Porcupine, and development of the exploration shaft at &#201;l&#233;onore.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	The engineering trade-off study related to the Cochenour gold project was completed during the
	third quarter of 2009. The study indicated that the best alternative to exploit the Cochenour/Bruce
	Channel deposit is to enlarge and upgrade the existing Cochenour
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage145"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	shaft and construct a 5 kilometer
	high speed haulage drift on the 5400 Level to connect to the Red Lake mine. This will enable the
	Bruce Channel deposit ore to be hauled directly to the Red Lake mine and processed at the existing
	mill facility. The haulage drift will also open up several kilometers of unexplored ground at depth
	between the Red Lake mine and the Cochenour/Bruce Channel deposit. The Cochenour project combines
	the existing workings of Goldcorp&#146;s historic Cochenour mine with the contiguous and down-dip Bruce
	Channel discovery, which was acquired by Goldcorp in the Gold Eagle transaction in September&nbsp;2008.
	It is a key component of the development plans for Red Lake and will be a significant contributor
	to the Company&#146;s long-term growth profile.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage146"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	CORPORATE DEVELOPMENTS
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Disposition of interest in the Morelos gold project
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	On February&nbsp;10, 2010, Goldcorp entered into an agreement with Gleichen Resources Ltd. for the sale
	of Goldcorp&#146;s 21.2% interest in the Morelos gold project in Mexico (&#147;El Lim&#243;n) in exchange for
	C$52.0&nbsp;million in cash. This transaction was completed on February&nbsp;24, 2010. As a result of this
	transaction, the Company recognized a $17.3&nbsp;million after tax ($24.0&nbsp;million before tax) write-down
	of its investment in El Lim&#243;n during the fourth quarter of 2009
<I>
	.
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Acquisition of subsidiary of New Gold Inc.
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	On January&nbsp;7, 2010, a subsidiary of New Gold exercised the right of first refusal pursuant to the
	El Morro Shareholders Agreement. The right of first refusal came into effect on October&nbsp;12, 2009
	when Barrick Gold Corporation (&#147;Barrick&#148;) entered into an agreement with Xstrata Copper Chile S.A.
	(&#147;Xstrata&#148;) to acquire Xstrata&#146;s 70% interest in Sociedad Contratual Minera El Morro, the owner of
	the El Morro gold/copper project in Chile (&#147;the El Morro project&#148;). Also on January&nbsp;7, 2010,
	Goldcorp entered into an agreement with New Gold Inc. (&#147;New Gold&#148;) whereby Goldcorp agreed to loan
	$463.0&nbsp;million to New Gold to fund the acquisition of Xstrata&#146;s 70% interest. Goldcorp also loaned
	$50.0&nbsp;million to a New Gold subsidiary which was paid to a different New Gold subsidiary in
	consideration of the internal assignment of the acquisition agreement with Xstrata. The acquisition
	of Xstrata&#146;s 70% interest by the New Gold subsidiary was completed on February&nbsp;16, 2010. Following
	this transaction, Goldcorp acquired the New Gold subsidiary. As a result of these transactions,
	Goldcorp now holds a 70% interest in the El Morro project with the remaining 30% held by New Gold.
	Goldcorp, as the project operator, has agreed to fund, through interest bearing loans, New Gold&#146;s
	share of development and construction costs until intended operating levels are achieved. The
	amounts outstanding will be repaid to Goldcorp during the production period of the El Morro
	project.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	The acquisition of the New Gold subsidiary will be accounted for as a business combination with the
	El Morro project being considered a separate reporting unit for the purpose of allocating goodwill.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	On January&nbsp;13, 2010, Goldcorp received a statement of claim filed by Barrick against Goldcorp, New
	Gold and certain of New Gold&#146;s subsidiaries, relating to the exercise of the right of first refusal
	by a New Gold subsidiary in respect of the El Morro project. The Company&#146;s management believes that
	Goldcorp has acted lawfully and appropriately in all aspects of this transaction and intends to
	defend Goldcorp against Barrick&#146;s claim.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Acquisition of Canplats Resources Corporation
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	On November&nbsp;16, 2009, Goldcorp entered into an agreement as amended on December&nbsp;23, 2009 and
	December&nbsp;29, 2009 with Canplats Resources Corporation (&#147;Canplats&#148;) to acquire all of the issued and
	outstanding common shares of Canplats for consideration of C$4.60 per common share outstanding at
	the closing date. This transaction completed on February&nbsp;4, 2010 for total consideration paid by
	the Company of C$295.6&nbsp;million ($275.4&nbsp;million) in cash. As a result of this transaction, Goldcorp
	now holds a 100% interest in the Camino Rojo gold/silver project in Mexico (&#147;the Camino Rojo
	project&#148;). This project is located approximately 50 kilometers southeast of Goldcorp&#146;s Pe&#241;asquito
	project in Mexico.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	This transaction will be accounted for as a business combination. The assets and liabilities of
	Canplats in addition to the goodwill resulting from the business combination, if any, will be
	assigned to and included in the Pe&#241;asquito reporting unit.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Disposition of investment in New Gold Inc. (formerly Peak Gold Ltd.)
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	On October&nbsp;13, 2009, the Company disposed of its 7% investment in New Gold which was classified as
	available-for-sale for net proceeds of $65.2&nbsp;million. As a result of this transaction, the Company
	recognized the cumulative mark-to-market gains previously
	recorded in AOCI of $43.0&nbsp;million in earnings (net gain of $42.8&nbsp;million, net of $0.2&nbsp;million in
	selling costs) during the fourth quarter of 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage147"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	The Company&#146;s 7% interest in New Gold resulted from the following transactions. Goldcorp sold its
	Peak gold mine in Australia and Amapari gold mine in Brazil to Peak Gold Ltd. (&#147;Peak Gold&#148;) in the
	second quarter of 2007, in exchange for $200.0&nbsp;million in cash and $100.0&nbsp;million in common shares
	of Peak Gold, representing a 22% equity interest in Peak Gold. Goldcorp&#146;s interest in Peak Gold was
	reduced to 18% in the first quarter of 2008 upon the exercise of special warrants issued by Peak
	Gold in November&nbsp;2007. Goldcorp lost significant influence over Peak Gold during the second quarter
	of 2008, at which time its investment was classified as available-for-sale and measured at fair
	value, based on quoted market prices of the underlying shares. On June&nbsp;30, 2008, Peak Gold
	completed a business combination with Metallica Resources Inc. and New Gold, with the combined
	company carrying on as New Gold. Former Peak Gold shareholders received 0.1 common share of New
	Gold and $0.0001 in cash for each common share of Peak Gold, which resulted in Goldcorp owning 7%
	of New Gold. The investment in New Gold was classified as available-for-sale and measured at fair
	value.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	During the period from June&nbsp;30, 2008, the date of the Peak Gold/New Gold combination, and December
	31, 2008, New Gold experienced adverse changes in the economic environment in which it operates and
	continued decline in the market price of its shares. As a result, the Company recorded an $81.5
	million impairment loss on its investment in New Gold during the fourth quarter of 2008. During
	2009, New Gold had excellent gold production and cash cost results along with successful
	advancement in its New Afton project. As a result, the fair value of Goldcorp&#146;s investment in New
	Gold increased during the period from January&nbsp;1, 2009 to October&nbsp;13, 2009 and the Company
	recognized mark-to-market gains in accumulated other comprehensive income (&#147;AOCI&#148;) totalling $43.0
	million.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Acquisition of Gold Eagle Mines Ltd.
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	On September&nbsp;25, 2008, the Company acquired the net assets of Gold Eagle Mines Ltd. (&#147;Gold Eagle&#148;)
	pursuant to a plan of arrangement.&nbsp;The total purchase price amounted to $1.3&nbsp;billion, comprising of
	$701.3&nbsp;million in cash, $536.6&nbsp;million in common shares issued, $6.0&nbsp;million in stock options
	issued, $8.0&nbsp;million in share purchase warrants issued, $26.7&nbsp;million in previously owned Gold
	Eagle shares and $8.2&nbsp;million in transaction costs. Gold Eagle&#146;s 100%&nbsp;owned property in the Red
	Lake camp is host to the Bruce Channel Discovery, a gold exploration project southwest of
	Goldcorp&#146;s Red Lake mine and contiguous to Goldcorp&#146;s Cochenour gold project. The acquisition
	secures control of eight kilometers of strike length along the prolific Red Lake trend in Ontario,
	Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	The transaction was accounted for as an asset purchase for accounting purposes. The purchase
	consideration, net of cash, cash equivalents and non-cash working capital acquired, was allocated
	to mining interests. The assets and liabilities of Gold Eagle are assigned to and included in the
	Red Lake reporting unit.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Disposition of shares of Silver Wheaton Corp.
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	On February&nbsp;14, 2008, Goldcorp disposed of 108&nbsp;million common shares of Silver Wheaton Corp.
	(&#147;Silver Wheaton&#148;), its remaining 48% interest in Silver Wheaton, to a syndicate of underwriters
	for gross and net proceeds of $1,571.0&nbsp;million and $1,505.1&nbsp;million, respectively. The net proceeds
	in excess of the carrying value of the shares at the date of disposition amounted to $969.3
	million. $279.4&nbsp;million of this amount was recognized in earnings in the first quarter of 2008 for
	a total gain of $292.5&nbsp;million ($136.5&nbsp;million after tax), including the realization of $17.7
	million of AOCI related to Silver Wheaton&#146;s investments, offset by $4.6&nbsp;million of other
	liabilities, with the remaining $689.9&nbsp;million applied against the carrying amounts of mining
	interests at San Dimas, Los Filos and Pe&#241;asquito as a result of the Company&#146;s arrangements to sell
	silver to Silver Wheaton.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	The disposition of Silver Wheaton shares is consistent with Goldcorp&#146;s commitment to simplify its
	corporate structure, while further strengthening its balance sheet. The results of Silver Wheaton
	were consolidated prior to the disposition.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Acquisition of full ownership of Porcupine and Musselwhite mines
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	On December&nbsp;21, 2007, the Company acquired Kinross Gold Corporation (&#147;Kinross&#148;)&#146;s 49% interest in
	the Porcupine gold mines in northeastern Ontario and 32% interest in the Musselwhite gold mine in
	northwestern Ontario in exchange for Goldcorp&#146;s 50% interest in the La Coipa gold/silver mine in
	Chile and $204.9&nbsp;million in cash, net of cash and cash equivalents acquired. The transaction
	enhanced Goldcorp&#146;s geographic focus in NAFTA countries, and exchanged an asset with a short-term
	mine life for the remaining joint venture interests in two long-life mining assets.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage148"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	This acquisition resulted in a change in the Company&#146;s accounting for Porcupine and Musselwhite
	from proportionate consolidation of its joint venture interests to consolidation of its full
	ownership of the mines commencing December&nbsp;21, 2007.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Sale of Pe&#241;asquito silver stream
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	On July&nbsp;24, 2007, Goldcorp entered into an agreement with Silver Wheaton to sell 25% of the silver
	produced from its Pe&#241;asquito project located in Mexico for the life of the mines. Total
	consideration paid by Silver Wheaton was $485.0&nbsp;million in cash. In addition, a per ounce cash
	payment of the lesser of $3.90 and the prevailing market price is due, subject to an inflationary
	adjustment, for silver delivered by Goldcorp under the contract.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Silver Wheaton borrowed $200.0&nbsp;million under a non-revolving term loan and $300.0&nbsp;million under a
	revolving term loan in order to finance the acquisition of the Pe&#241;asquito silver contract. At
	February&nbsp;14, 2008, upon disposition of its interest in Silver Wheaton, Goldcorp was no longer
	obligated for this long-term debt.
</DIV>
