<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As a result of the sale of Goldcorp&#146;s 50% interest in La Coipa in December&nbsp;2007,
	the results of that mine have been reclassified as a discontinued operation, in
	accordance with GAAP. Where noted, certain results above have been presented
	including La Coipa for informational purposes only.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Includes the operating results of Peak and Amapari to April&nbsp;27, 2007 and March
	31, 2007, the respective dates of disposition. Includes 100% of the operating
	results of Porcupine and Musselwhite after December&nbsp;21, 2007, and 51% and 68%,
	respectively, prior to December&nbsp;21, 2007.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Includes the operating results of Silver Wheaton to February&nbsp;14, 2008, the date
	of disposition.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The San Martin mine ended its mining process in October&nbsp;2007 and commenced
	reclamation activities at that time. Total cash costs for 2008 and beyond have been
	presented excluding San Martin for informational purposes only.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(5)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Total cash costs per gold ounce on a by-product basis is calculated net of
	by-product sales revenue (by-product copper revenues for Peak and Alumbrera;
	by-product silver revenues for La Coipa and Marlin at market silver prices; and
	by-product silver revenues for San Dimas at $4.02 per silver ounce ($3.95 prior to
	November&nbsp;2008) sold to Silver Wheaton).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(6)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Total cash costs per gold ounce on a co-product basis is calculated by
	allocating operating cash costs separately to metals using a ratio of revenues from
	metals as a proportion of total revenues for Peak and Alumbrera (includes copper
	revenues); and La Coipa, Marlin and San Dimas (includes silver revenues).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage150"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Review of Annual Financial Results
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Net earnings for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 were $240.2&nbsp;million, or $0.33 per share, compared
	to $1,475.6&nbsp;million, or $2.07 per share in 2008. Compared to 2008, net earnings were impacted
	significantly by the following factors:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenues increased by $304.0&nbsp;million, or 13%, primarily due to a $298.3&nbsp;million increase
	in gold revenues resulting from a $110 per ounce increase in realized gold prices and a 2%
	increase in gold sales volume and a $14.2&nbsp;million increase in copper revenues resulting
	from a 19% increase in realized copper prices, offset by a 12% decrease in copper sales
	volume;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Operating expenses increased by $23.1&nbsp;million, or 2%, primarily as a result of the
	higher gold and silver sales volumes, employee costs, consumption of consumables/reagents,
	maintenance costs and export retention taxes ($51.7&nbsp;million in 2009, compared to $42.9
	million in 2008), offset by the positive impact of the weakening of the Canadian dollar by
	7% and the Mexican peso by 21% ($44.8&nbsp;million) and lower YMAD net proceeds payments ($39.1
	million in 2009, compared to $47.3&nbsp;million in 2008);
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Depreciation and depletion increased by $27.1&nbsp;million, or 5%, primarily as a result of
	the 4% increase in gold production and increase in reclamation expenditures expensed
	directly in earnings relating to closed mines;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Exploration costs decreased by $34.0 million, or 51%, due to the focus on key
	development projects, in line with the Company&#146;s 2009 plan;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">

<B>

</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A $17.3&nbsp;million after tax ($24.0&nbsp;million before tax) write-down of the Company&#146;s
	investment in El Lim&#243;n during the fourth quarter of 2009 as a result of the transaction
	with Gleichen which completed on February&nbsp;24, 2010, with sales proceeds below the carrying
	amount of the investment prior to the write-down, compared to a $30.9&nbsp;million after tax
	($47.1&nbsp;million before tax) write-down in the carrying amount of the Pamour open pit mining
	property at Porcupine in 2008 due to the loss of reserve ounces as at December&nbsp;31, 2008;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</B>

<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Interest and other income (expenses)&nbsp;decreased by $47.4&nbsp;million primarily due to the
	accrual of $17.6&nbsp;million relating to withholding taxes in 2009 and the higher interest
	earned on the significant cash balances held throughout 2008, which arose from the sale of
	the Pe&#241;asquito silver stream in the third quarter of 2007 and the disposition of the Silver
	Wheaton shares in the first quarter of 2008, offset by interest earned during 2009 on cash
	balances resulting from the proceeds on the $862.5&nbsp;million convertible senior notes issued
	by the Company on June&nbsp;5, 2009;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<!-- /FOLIO -->

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage151"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	and 6% strengthening of the Canadian dollar and Mexican peso, respectively, during the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, compared to a $1,070.9&nbsp;million non-cash foreign exchange gain
	in 2008 due to the 24% and 27% weakening of the Canadian dollar and Mexican peso,
	respectively, during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Adjusted net earnings amounted to $588.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, compared to
	$397.0&nbsp;million in 2008. Compared to 2008, adjusted net earnings were impacted by increased revenues
	resulting primarily from higher realized gold prices ($110 per ounce) and higher gold sales volume,
	offset by higher operating costs. Total cash costs (by-product) were lower at $295 per ounce for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, as compared to $305 per ounce in 2008. The decrease was primarily
	due to higher by-product sales revenue credits resulting from higher realized copper prices, offset
	by a 12% decrease in copper sales volume and increased consumable, employee and maintenance costs.
	Adjusted net earnings was also impacted by the lower effective tax rate in 2009, as compared to
	2008, which is primarily due to the impact of additional tax benefits recognized from the
	harmonization of the Ontario corporate income tax with the Federal tax system, offset by the use of
	Mexican flat tax credits on taxable earnings in Mexico in 2008.&nbsp;The effective tax rate in 2009 also
	includes the impact of a reduction of future income tax liabilities of $40.1&nbsp;million resulting from
	Canadian provincial and federal income tax rate reductions enacted in the fourth quarter of
	2009.&nbsp;This has been offset by increases in future income tax liabilities in Mexico of $26.2&nbsp;million
	as a result of the changes in Mexican income tax laws and an additional income tax liability of
	$12.8&nbsp;million arising from changes to the Mexican consolidated tax return rules enacted in the
	fourth quarter of 2009.
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Excludes commissioning sales ounces from Pe&#241;asquito as these are credited
	against capitalized project costs.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Sum of quarterly earnings per share may not equal the total for the year as each
	quarterly amount is calculated independently of each other.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The San Martin mine ended its mining process in October&nbsp;2007 and commenced
	reclamation activities at that time. Total cash costs have been presented excluding
	San Martin for information purposes only.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Total cash costs per gold ounce on a by-product basis is calculated net of
	by-product sales revenues (by-product copper revenues for Alumbrera; by-product
	silver revenues for Marlin at market silver prices; and by-product silver revenues
	for San Dimas at $4.02 per silver ounce ($3.95 prior to November&nbsp;2008) sold to
	Silver Wheaton).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(5)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Total cash costs per gold ounce on a co-product basis is calculated by
	allocating operating cash costs separately to metals using a ratio of revenues from
	metals as a proportion of total revenues for Alumbrera (includes copper revenues);
	and Marlin and San Dimas (includes silver revenues).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Includes the operating results of Silver Wheaton to February&nbsp;14, 2008, the date
	of disposition.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Excludes commissioning sales ounces from Pe&#241;asquito as these are credited
	against capitalized project costs.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Sum of quarterly earnings per share may not equal the total for the year as each
	quarterly amount is calculated independently of each other.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The San Martin mine ended its mining process in October&nbsp;2007 and commenced
	reclamation activities at that time. Total cash costs have been presented excluding
	San Martin for information purposes only.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(5)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Total cash costs per gold ounce on a by-product basis is calculated net of
	by-product sales revenues (by-product copper revenues for Alumbrera; by-product
	silver revenues for Marlin at market silver prices; and by-product silver revenues
	for San Dimas at $4.02 per silver ounce ($3.95 prior to November&nbsp;2008) sold to
	Silver Wheaton).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(6)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Total cash costs per gold ounce on a co-product basis is calculated by
	allocating operating cash costs separately to metals using a ratio of revenues from
	metals as a proportion of total revenues for Alumbrera (includes copper revenues);
	and Marlin and San Dimas (includes silver revenues).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage154"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Review of Quarterly Financial Results
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Net earnings for the fourth quarter of 2009 were $66.7&nbsp;million or $0.09 per share, compared with
	$114.2&nbsp;million or $0.16 per share in the third quarter of 2009. Compared to the prior quarter, net
	earnings for the three months ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 were impacted significantly by the following
	factors:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenues increased by $86.4&nbsp;million, or 12%, primarily due to a $50.9&nbsp;million increase
	in gold revenues resulting from a $139 per ounce increase in realized gold prices, offset
	by a 5% decrease in gold sales volume, a $26.0&nbsp;million increase in copper revenues
	resulting from a 2% increase in copper realized prices and 29% increase in copper sales
	volume, and a $5.6&nbsp;million increase in silver revenues resulting from a 17% increase in
	silver realized prices and 6% increase in silver sales volumes;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Operating expenses increased by $18.4&nbsp;million, or 6%, primarily due to the increase in
	copper and silver sales volumes, and $4.5&nbsp;million higher YMAD net proceeds payments and
	$2.5&nbsp;million higher export retention taxes paid in Alumbrera;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Depreciation and depletion increased by $10.7&nbsp;million, or 8%, primarily as a result of
	higher depletable costs and reclamation expenditures expensed directly in earnings relating
	to closed mines;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Corporate administration increased by $9.7&nbsp;million primarily due to the timing of
	expenditures;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A $17.3&nbsp;million after tax ($24.0&nbsp;million before tax) write-down of the Company&#146;s
	investment in El Lim&#243;n during the fourth quarter of 2009 as a result of the transaction
	with Gleichen which completed on February&nbsp;24, 2010, with sales proceeds below the carrying
	amount of the investment prior to the write-down;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Interest and other income (expenses)&nbsp;decreased by $12.7&nbsp;million primarily due to the
	accrual of $17.6&nbsp;million relating to withholding taxes, offset by $2.2&nbsp;million received
	during the fourth quarter of 2009 for a business interruption claim relating to a
	crusher/conveyor system failure in Musselwhite and $2.9&nbsp;million of severance and shut-down
	costs incurred during the prior quarter relating to the mill shut-down at Los Filos
	underground;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Interest expense and finance fees increased by $9.5&nbsp;million primarily due to $10.3
	million of accrued interest relating to withholding taxes;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A $5.7&nbsp;million loss on non-hedge derivatives, compared to $0.4&nbsp;million loss in the prior
	quarter;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A $42.8&nbsp;million gain on securities (before and after tax), net of selling costs, on the
	disposition of the Company&#146;s 7% equity investment in New Gold;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A $15.1&nbsp;million after tax gain ($20.1&nbsp;million before tax) on disposition of certain
	mining interests;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A $122.6&nbsp;million foreign exchange loss on the translation of future income tax
	liabilities on mining interests arising primarily from the Placer Dome and Glamis
	acquisitions in 2006 and Gold Eagle acquisition in the third quarter of 2008, compared to a
	$17.5&nbsp;million loss in the prior quarter, due to the increased volatility of the Canadian
	dollar and Mexican peso in the fourth quarter of 2009;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Adjusted net earnings amounted to $182.7&nbsp;million for the fourth quarter of 2009, compared to $140.6
	million in the prior quarter. Compared to the prior quarter, adjusted net earnings were impacted by
	increased revenues resulting primarily from higher realized gold prices ($139 per ounce) and higher
	copper sales volume, offset by lower gold sales volume, higher operating costs and higher corporate
	administration expenses due to timing of expenditures. Total cash costs (by-product) were lower at
	$289 per ounce, as compared to $295 per ounce in the prior quarter. The decrease was primarily due
	to higher by-product sales revenue credits and higher gold sales volume.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	When compared to the fourth quarter of 2008, adjusted net earnings for the fourth quarter of 2009
	increased by $98.3&nbsp;million, or 117% (fourth quarter of 2008 &#150; $84.4&nbsp;million). The main factors
	contributing to the higher adjusted net earnings in the fourth quarter of
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage155"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	2009 were 39%, 277% and
	66% higher gold, copper and silver realized prices, respectively ($310 per ounce, $2.71 per pound
	and $4.31 per ounce, respectively), 12% higher silver sales volume and lower exploration costs as
	the Company focused on key development projects. Offsetting these increases were 16% and 43% lower
	gold and copper sales volumes, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13
</DIV>

	&nbsp;

<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Total cash costs per gold ounce is calculated net of by-product sales revenues
	(by-product copper revenues for Alumbrera; by-product silver revenues for Marlin at
	market silver prices; and by-product silver revenues for San Dimas at $4.02 per silver
	ounce ($3.95 prior to November&nbsp;2008) sold to Silver Wheaton).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Represents commissioning production ounces from Pe&#241;asquito. Sales ounces and
	related sales revenues are excluded as sales revenues are credited against capitalized
	project costs.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The San Martin mine ended its mining process in October&nbsp;2007 and commenced
	reclamation activities at that time. Total cash costs above have been presented
	excluding San Martin for information purposes only.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As a result of the agreement entered into with Gleichen on February&nbsp;10, 2010, the
	Company recognized a $24.0&nbsp;million before tax ($17.3&nbsp;million after tax) write-down of
	its investment in the El Lim&#243;n during the fourth quarter of 2009.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(5)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Includes corporate activities, the operating results of Silver Wheaton to February
	14, 2008, the date of disposition and San Martin.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P>
<A NAME="eolPage157"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>

	&nbsp;

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Total cash costs per gold ounce is calculated net of by-product sales revenues
	(by-product copper revenues for Alumbrera; by-product silver revenues for Marlin at
	market silver prices; and by-product silver revenues for San Dimas at $4.02 per silver
	ounce ($3.95 prior to November&nbsp;2008) sold to Silver Wheaton).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Represents commissioning production ounces from Pe&#241;asquito. Sales ounces and
	related sales revenues are excluded as sales revenues are credited against capitalized
	project costs.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The San Martin mine ended its mining process in October&nbsp;2007 and commenced
	reclamation activities at that time. Total cash costs above have been presented
	excluding San Martin for information purposes only.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As a result of the agreement entered into with Gleichen on February&nbsp;10, 2010, the
	Company recognized a $24.0&nbsp;million before tax ($17.3&nbsp;million after tax) write-down of
	its investment in the El Lim&#243;n during the fourth quarter of 2009.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(5)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Includes corporate activities, the operating results of Silver Wheaton to February
	14, 2008, the date of disposition and San Martin.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production in 2009 was 622,700 ounces, at a cash cost of $288 per ounce, compared to 629,200
	ounces, at a cash cost of $302 per ounce in 2008. The focus during 2009 was on accelerated
	development and exploration to increase mining flexibility in the high grade zone. The increased
	development enables mill throughput to increase and utilize available capacity, which is expected
	to lead to higher production in 2010. In comparison to 2008, Red Lake experienced 2% lower grades
	at 25.9 g/t compared to 26.4 g/t, offset by 2% higher tonnage.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs were 5%, or $14 per ounce, lower than in 2008 due to a weaker Canadian dollar ($27 per
	ounce, or 193%) and higher gold sales ($8 per ounce, or 57%), offset by higher operating costs ($21
	per ounce, or 150%). The increase in operating costs was attributable to higher employee costs
	($7.4&nbsp;million) and long-hole drilling costs associated with reducing the stress envelope around the
	high grade zone ($3.7&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	During the second quarter of 2009, the installation of underground infrastructure was completed
	which included the dewatering system and the second phase of the ventilation system at the #3
	shaft.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Throughout 2009, an accelerated exploration program progressed to define the High Grade zone at
	depth. The early completion of the 4199 drift in the second quarter of 2009 allowed exploration of
	the High Grade zone at depth for the first time in many years. Numerous high grade intersections
	were encountered in the High Grade zone and in the Footwall zone. Exploration drilling from the
	4199 drift will continue in 2010 and beyond.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	During 2009, the Cochenour mine was dewatered to the 1650&#146; level. Dewatering is anticipated to be
	completed to the 2050 level which will allow for targeted exploration to commence during the first
	quarter of 2010. An engineering trade-off study was completed during the third quarter of 2009. The
	study indicated that the best alternative to exploit the Cochenour/Bruce Channel deposit is to
	enlarge and upgrade the existing Cochenour shaft and construct a 5 kilometer high speed haulage
	drift on the 5400 Level to connect to the Red Lake mine. This will enable the Bruce Channel deposit
	ore to be transported directly to the Red Lake mine and processed at the existing mill facility.
	The haulage drift will also open up several kilometers of unexplored ground at depth between the
	Red Lake mine and the Cochenour/Bruce Channel deposit. Capital expenditures during the fourth
	quarter of 2009 and the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009
	amounted to $10.3&nbsp;million and $22.7&nbsp;million, respectively, consisting of exploration, dewatering
	and preparatory work for the
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;16
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage159"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	development of the high speed haulage drift. The Cochenour project
	combines the existing workings of Goldcorp&#146;s historic Cochenour mine with the contiguous and
	down-dip Bruce Channel gold discovery.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for the fourth quarter of 2009 was 13%, or 22,500 ounces, less than in the third
	quarter of 2009. In comparison to the prior quarter, Red Lake experienced 10% lower grades and 2%
	higher mill throughput, as planned. Grades in the prior quarter were higher due to more material
	from the High Grade zone at depth (43 and 44 Levels) and reduced mining dilution. Cash costs for
	the fourth quarter of 2009 were 24%, or $62 per ounce, higher than in the prior quarter due to
	higher operating costs ($28 per ounce, or 45%), lower gold production ($27 per ounce, or 44%) and a
	stronger Canadian dollar ($7 per ounce, or 11%).
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_45"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;17
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During the fourth quarter of 2008, the Company recognized a $30.9&nbsp;million
	after tax ($47.1&nbsp;million before tax) write-down of its mining interests at the
	Pamour open pit as a result of a reduction of 1.4&nbsp;million in its proven and
	probable ounces of gold reserves.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for 2009 was 9%, or 27,300 ounces, more than in 2008 due to 6% higher mill
	throughput and 3% higher grades. At the Dome underground, previous improvements to sand fill
	removal from ore and additional bulk stopes resulted in 9% higher grades and 89% higher tonnage.
	The Hoyle Pond underground operation experienced 9% higher grades due to increased mining of higher
	grade veins and similar tonnage. The Pamour Pit operation experienced 10% lower grades and 1% lower
	tonnage with the suspension of open pit mining in July of 2009. Surface medium and low grade stock
	piles have replaced the Pamour ore feeds.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs were 24%, or $141 per ounce, lower than in 2008 due to lower operating costs ($56 per
	ounce, or 40%), higher gold production ($45 per ounce, or 32%) and a weaker Canadian dollar ($40
	per ounce, or 28%). Operating costs decreased primarily due to the suspension of mining of the
	Pamour open pit, diesel fuel ($7.2&nbsp;million), explosives ($5.2&nbsp;million), maintenance parts ($3.9
	million), offset by higher power costs on the increased tonnage ($1.9&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Exploration during 2009 continued to focus on further reserve definition of the VAZ zone
	mineralization and following extensions of the TVZ zone and the North Mafic zone. The Hoyle Pond
	mine realized improved gold grades and the extension of several gold structures at depth. The
	exploration success supports the Company&#146;s planned capital investments in mine development over the
	next four years, which include a deep winze (shaft)&nbsp;to access new zones at Hoyle Pond, enhancement
	of operational flexibility in accessing the current mining zones and an increase in efficiencies in
	travel time and skipping ore and waste.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for the fourth quarter of 2009 was 21%, or 18,900 ounces, less than in the third
	quarter of 2009 due to 17% lower grades primarily from Hoyle Pond and the processing of lower grade
	stockpile at the Pamour Pit. In comparison to the prior quarter, the Dome underground operation
	experienced 15% higher grades and 2% lower tonnage due to higher than planned grades from several
	stopes and reduced ore tonnes during development. The Hoyle Pond underground operation experienced
	24% lower grades primarily due to timing of development in the high grade VAZ zone and 3% lower
	tonnage due to sequencing of stope blocks, rehabilitation and equipment availability. In comparison
	to the prior quarter, stockpile processing at the Pamour Pit provided 23% lower grades due to the
	transitioning from medium to low grade stockpiles and 1% lower tonnage.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;18
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage161"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs for the fourth quarter of 2009 were 25%, or $103 per ounce, higher than in the prior
	quarter due to lower gold production ($114 per ounce, or 111%), a stronger Canadian dollar ($3 per
	ounce, or 3%), offset by lower operating costs ($14 per ounce, or 14%). The decrease in operating
	costs was primarily attributable to lower costs for maintenance and certain consumables.
</DIV>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for 2009 was 10%, or 22,100 ounces, more than in 2008 due to 7% higher grades and
	4% higher mill throughput. The higher grades were due to a higher proportion of material being
	mined from the PQ Deeps and PG zone. The higher mill throughput resulted from increased stope
	flexibility within the mine plan, as compared to 2008, when a mechanical issue with the
	crushing/conveying system and ground control issues impacted underground tonnage.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs were 4%, or $26 per ounce, lower than in 2008 due to a weaker Canadian dollar ($49 per
	ounce, or 188%) and higher gold production ($46 per ounce, or 177%), offset by higher operating
	costs ($69 per ounce, or 265%). The increase in operating costs was primarily attributable to
	higher development costs incurred to improve stope flexibility during production ($5.4&nbsp;million),
	higher costs for maintenance on the crusher, conveyor, leach and grinding circuits ($4.1&nbsp;million),
	higher employee costs ($2.7&nbsp;million) and increased camp and freight costs ($3.2&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Musselwhite continued to produce successful exploration results during 2009. Underground
	exploration on the PQ Deeps extended the known resource, extending both the C- and D-blocks, while
	defining the final northern extent of the A-block. Delineation drilling on the southern portion of
	the PQ Deeps extended the D-block and provided better definition of the A- and C-blocks. Drilling
	on the Moose zone extended the resource and saw the re-emergence of the S1 and S2 zones. All zones,
	with the exception of the A-block of the PQ Deeps are open to the north.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for the fourth quarter of 2009 was 13%, or 6,500 ounces, more than in the third
	quarter of 2009. The higher production was due to improved stope flexibility and continuous
	operations, as compared to the prior quarter, which included an 11-day planned shutdown for plant
	and electrical maintenance. Cash costs for the fourth quarter of 2009 were 18%, or $132 per ounce,
	lower than in the prior quarter due to higher gold production ($97 per ounce, or 74%) and lower
	operating costs ($49 per ounce, or 37%), offset by a stronger Canadian dollar ($14 per ounce, or
	11%). The decrease in operating costs was primarily due to reduced maintenance costs ($1.9&nbsp;million)
	and lower employee costs ($1.7&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<TD ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	22.1
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	$
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT">
	32.2
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<!-- END TABLE BODY -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Silver was sold to Silver Wheaton at a price of $4.04 per ounce ($4.02
	prior to November&nbsp;2009). The calculation of total cash costs per ounce of gold is
	net of by-product silver sales revenue.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for 2009 was 30%, or 26,300 ounces, more than in 2008 due to additional high grade
	stopes in the Roberta and Robertita veins in the Central Block area. Silver production for 2009 was
	consistent with production for 2008. In comparison to 2008, San Dimas experienced 25% higher and 5%
	lower grades for gold and silver, respectively, and 2% higher tonnage due to ore from exploration
	drifting.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs for 2009 were 29%, or $118 per ounce, lower than in 2008 due to higher gold production
	($86 per ounce, or 73%) and a weaker Mexican peso ($48 per ounce, or 41%), offset by higher
	operating costs ($16 per ounce, or 14%). The increase in operating costs was attributable to
	employee costs ($2.4&nbsp;million), maintenance ($1.1&nbsp;million) and consumables ($1.1&nbsp;million) due to
	increased tonnage, partially offset by lower energy and fuel costs ($1.6&nbsp;million) as a result of
	operating the Las Truchas hydro-electric plant for the full year in comparison to seven months in
	2008.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Positive exploration results were obtained throughout 2009 with three veins confirmed in the
	Sinaloa Graben Block (Julieta, North Sinaloa and Robertita).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	The San Francisco ore pass was completed during the third quarter of 2009 and is now in use and
	providing operating efficiencies in ore haulage. The San Luis Bridge was completed during the
	fourth quarter of 2009 and represents the first stage of the new waste rock dump expected to be
	completed by 2011.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold and silver production for the fourth quarter of 2009 were 12%, or 3,300 ounces, and 3%, or
	42,900 ounces more, respectively, than in the third quarter of 2009 due to higher grades from the
	Roberta, Robertita and Marina veins in the Central Block area. In
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;21
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage164"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	comparison to the prior quarter,
	San Dimas experienced 15% and 6% higher grades for gold and silver, respectively, offset by 3%
	lower tonnage. Cash costs for the fourth quarter of 2009 were 13%, or $41 per ounce, lower than in
	the third quarter of 2009 primarily due to higher gold production.
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Cash costs per ounce for the Los Filos open pit were $446 for 2009 and
	$444, $436, $471 and $442 for the fourth, third, second and first quarters,
	respectively.&nbsp; Total cash costs reported include the results of the underground
	operation.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Recovery is reported on a cumulative basis starting in the second quarter of
	2008, to reflect the cumulative recovery of ore on the leach pad, and does not
	reflect the true recovery expected over time.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for 2009 was 12%, or 25,700 ounces, more than in 2008, mainly due to higher tonnage
	and recovery. In comparison to 2008, Los Filos experienced 20% higher tonnes moved and 15% higher
	tonnes processed. The Los Filos pit operation experienced 11% lower grades and 4% higher tonnage,
	the El Bermejal pit operation experienced 12% higher grades and 20% higher tonnage, and the
	underground operation experienced 13% lower grades and 4% higher tonnage. The increase in tonnage
	was made possible by the increase in heap leach pad space with the completion of the third stage of
	the heap leach pad in the second quarter of 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs were 15%, or $62 per ounce, higher than in 2008 due to higher operating costs ($143 per
	ounce, or 231%), offset by higher gold production ($41 per ounce, or 66%) and a weaker Mexican peso
	($40 per ounce, or 65%). The increase in operating costs was attributable to increased consumption
	of reagents ($10.7&nbsp;million), maintenance ($4.0&nbsp;million), community related costs ($3.7&nbsp;million),
	employee costs ($2.0&nbsp;million) and fuel ($1.6&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	In addition to the construction of the third stage of the heap leach pad, the dewatering trench was
	completed during the second quarter of 2009. Construction of the buttress to provide stability for
	future growth of the heap leach pad was completed during the fourth quarter of 2009. Construction
	of the conveying system for the crushing and agglomeration plant of higher-grade ore is progressing
	as planned and commissioning is expected in the first quarter of 2010.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	The 2009 exploration drilling program at Los Filos provided good results, including an increase to
	reserves.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for the fourth quarter of 2009 was similar to the third quarter of 2009 despite
	closing of the underground mill facility in the third quarter of 2009. This is mainly due to 11%
	higher tonnage and 10% higher grades at the open pit operations.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;23
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage166"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs for the fourth quarter of 2009 were 2%, or $11 per ounce, lower than in the third
	quarter of 2009, primarily due to lower operating costs. The lower operating costs are the direct
	impact of the shutdown of the underground mill facility in the third quarter of 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	The Los Filos underground mine contributed 15,100 gold ounces to the total production during 2009,
	at a cash cost of $780 per ounce, compared to 24,700 gold ounces in 2008, at a cash cost of $666
	per ounce. The milling facility that previously processed the underground ore was closed at the end
	of August&nbsp;2009, consistent with the plan to integrate the underground operation with the existing
	infrastructure in the Los Filos open pit. Ore from the underground mine is being stockpiled and
	will be processed through the crushing and agglomeration plant in early 2010 and placed onto the
	heap leach pad.
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<!-- END TABLE BODY -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for 2009 was 26%, or 70,400 ounces, less than in 2008, mainly due to 26% lower
	grades as expected. El Sauzal is in the latter years of its mine life and the resulting decline in
	production is occurring as anticipated.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs were 35%, or $52 per ounce, higher than in 2008 due to lower gold production ($49 per
	ounce, or 94%) and higher operating costs ($33 per ounce, or 64%), offset by a weaker Mexican peso
	($30 per ounce, or 58%). The increase in operating costs was attributable to employee costs ($1.2
	million) and maintenance ($1.3&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for the fourth quarter of 2009 was 25%, or 11,300 ounces, less than in the third
	quarter of 2009. In comparison to the prior quarter, El Sauzal experienced 21% lower grades and 4%
	lower mill throughput. Cash costs for the fourth quarter of 2009 were 69%, or $151 per ounce,
	higher than in the third quarter of 2009, due to lower gold production ($79 per ounce, or 52%) and
	higher operating costs ($74 per ounce, or 49%), offset by a net positive impact from foreign
	currency resulting from gains on foreign currency contracts, offset by a stronger Mexican peso ($2
	per ounce, or 1%). The increase in operating costs was primarily attributable to additional
	equipment leases for waste removal.
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_50"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;25
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage168"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;

<P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The calculation of total cash costs per ounce of gold sold is net of
	by-product silver sales revenue. If silver was treated as a co-product, total
	cash costs at Marlin for 2009 would be $341 per ounce of gold and $4.98 per
	ounce of silver (2008 &#150; $321 and $5.05, respectively).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold and silver production for 2009 were 14%, or 33,500 ounces, and 29%, or 944,000 ounces, more
	than in 2008. In comparison to 2008, Marlin experienced 17% higher mill throughput, 3% and 13%
	higher gold and silver recoveries, respectively, offset slightly by 6% and 3% lower gold and silver
	grades, respectively. The increase in recoveries was due to improvements in the Merrill Crowe and
	milling areas.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs were 1%, or $1 per ounce, higher than in 2008 due to higher operating costs ($75 per
	ounce, or 7500%), offset by higher gold production ($47 per ounce, or 4700%) and higher silver
	by-product sales credits ($27 per ounce, or 2700%). The increase in operating costs was primarily
	attributable to an increase in royalties and community development expenditures ($5.4&nbsp;million) and
	employee costs ($5.3&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold and silver production for the fourth quarter of 2009 were 14%, or 9,800 ounces, and 23%, or
	248,000 ounces more, respectively, than in the third quarter of 2009. The increase in production
	was due to 13% and 8% higher gold and silver grades, respectively, and 10% higher silver
	recoveries. The higher grades were mainly due to higher grades from underground mining. The higher
	recoveries were due to further positive impact from processing improvements implemented in the
	prior quarter which includes the use of lead nitrate in the leach tanks and optimization of the
	leach pH level.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Underground ore tonnage mined for the fourth quarter of 2009 increased by 3% as compared to the
	third quarter of 2009, averaging 2,020 tonnes per day. The increase in mining rate was due to a
	higher percentage of production using long-hole stope mining in appropriate areas. In comparison to
	the prior quarter, the underground operation experienced
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;26
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage169"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	13% and 16% higher gold and silver
	grades, respectively. Open pit ore tonnage mined for the fourth quarter of 2009 increased by 10%,
	while gold and silver grades increased by 32% and decreased by 4%, respectively, as compared to the
	third quarter 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs for the fourth quarter of 2009 were 30%, or $56 per ounce, lower than in the third
	quarter of 2009 due to higher silver by-product sales credits ($45 per ounce, or 80%) and higher
	gold production ($39 per ounce, or 70%), offset by higher operating costs ($28 per ounce, or 50%).
	The increase in operating costs was primarily attributable to an increase in employee costs ($2.8
	million).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;27
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The calculation of total cash costs per ounce of gold is net of
	by-product copper sales revenue. If copper was treated as a co-product, cash
	costs at Alumbrera for 2009 would be $434 per ounce of gold and $1.54 per pound
	of copper (2008 &#150; $408 and $1.37, respectively).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Goldcorp&#146;s share of Alumbrera&#146;s gold and copper production in 2009 was 16%, or 31,000 ounces, and
	9%, or 11.4&nbsp;million pounds, less than in 2008, respectively, which was anticipated. Gold production
	decreased due to 11% lower gold grades and 7% lower gold recoveries. Copper production decreased
	due to 8% lower copper grades.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs were 61%, or $273 per ounce, lower than in 2008 due to higher copper by-product sales
	credits resulting mainly from higher copper prices ($418 per ounce, or 153%), lower operating costs
	($100 per ounce, or 37%) and lower YMAD net proceeds payments ($52 per ounce, or 19%), offset by
	lower gold ounces sold ($297 per ounce, or 109%). The decrease in operating costs was primarily due
	to lower costs for fuel, other consumables and contractors.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Goldcorp&#146;s share of Alumbrera&#146;s gold and copper production for the fourth quarter of 2009 was 17%,
	or 5,100 ounces, and 43%, or 9.7&nbsp;million pounds, more than in the third quarter of 2009, as
	planned. In comparison to the prior quarter, Alumbrera experienced 4% higher tonnage, 10% and 26%
	higher gold and copper grades, respectively, 1% lower gold recovery and 10% higher copper recovery.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs for the fourth quarter of 2009 were 62%, or $510 per ounce, lower than in the third
	quarter of 2009 due to higher copper by-product sales credits resulting mainly from higher copper
	prices ($823 per ounce, or 161%), offset by higher YMAD net proceeds payments ($136 per ounce, or
	27%), higher operating costs ($129 per ounce, or 25%) and lower gold ounces sold ($48 per ounce, or
	9%). The increase in operating costs was primarily attributable to higher maintenance and
	contractor costs. The provisional pricing
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;28
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage171"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	impact of higher realized copper prices during the fourth
	quarter of 2009 was $13.6&nbsp;million, or $416 per ounce, of which $8.9&nbsp;million, or $272 per ounce
	related to copper sales in the third quarter of 2009 that settled in the fourth quarter of 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Late in 2007, the Argentine government informed mining exporters that their products would be
	subject to an export retention tax. Alumbrera continues to contest the payment of this retention
	tax and dialogue with the government is ongoing. The impact of the retention tax in the fourth
	quarter of 2009 was $13.1&nbsp;million, which has been excluded from cash costs. Had this amount been
	included, by-product cash costs would have increased by $402 per ounce. The total amount of
	retention tax paid to date amounts to $99.2&nbsp;million (Goldcorp&#146;s share).
</DIV>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	$
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT">
	2.8
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	$
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	29.3
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	$
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT">
	14.6
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<!-- END TABLE BODY -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Goldcorp&#146;s share of Marigold&#146;s production for 2009 was 2%, or 1,700 ounces, more than in 2008. In
	comparison to 2008, Marigold experienced 21% higher grades and 25% higher tonnes processed. The
	higher grades were due to mining from the higher grade areas of the Basalt Pit, in comparison to
	2008, when lower grade areas of the Basalt and Antler Pits were mined. Six new 300-tonne haul
	trucks and a backup loader were commissioned during 2009 which resulted in 13% higher total tonnes
	mined and an increase in leach pad inventory in the second half of the year.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs were 2%, or $12 per ounce, lower than in 2008 due to higher gold production ($38 per
	ounce, or 317%), offset by higher operating costs ($26 per ounce, or 217%). The increase in
	operating costs was attributable to higher maintenance ($4.7&nbsp;million), employee costs ($2.5
	million) and royalties and production taxes ($1.7&nbsp;million), offset by lower costs for fuel,
	explosives and reagents ($5.1&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Exploration during 2009 focused on the Red Dot resource and the Pediment areas to the north of the
	property. Pediment targets were generated from geochemical sampling and further interpretation of
	geophysical data. The recent exploration in the Red Dot area resulted in a 730,000 ounce reserve
	addition.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for the fourth quarter of 2009 was 7%, or 2,000 ounces, more than in the third
	quarter of 2009. The increase was due to 31% higher grades from lower levels of the Basalt Pit and
	the placement of ore near the bottom of the leach pad which allowed for quicker processing of
	solution. Cash costs for the fourth quarter of 2009 were 11%, or $60 per ounce, lower than in the
	third quarter of 2009 mainly due to higher gold production.
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_53"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;30
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>

	10.3
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<!-- END TABLE BODY -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for 2009 was 12%, or 7,000 ounces, more than in 2008. In comparison to 2008,
	improved leach pad management and plant improvements offset the impact of the 5% lower grades and
	2% lower tonnage.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs were 43%, or $205 per ounce, higher than in 2008 due to higher operating costs ($254 per
	ounce, or 124%), offset by higher gold production ($49 per ounce, or 24%). The increase in
	operating costs was attributable to higher usage of consumables, employee costs, pad three
	unloading costs and stripping costs.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Gold production for the fourth quarter of 2009 was 5%, or 900 ounces, less than in the third
	quarter of 2009. In comparison to the prior quarter, Wharf experienced 6% lower grades and 6% lower
	tonnage processed which was offset by quicker recovery of ounces from the recently unloaded pad
	three due to the ore being closer to the liner.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Cash costs for the fourth quarter of 2009 were 21%, or $140 per ounce, higher than in the third
	quarter of 2009 primarily due to the lower grade ore and tonnes processed and the higher cost
	ounces unloaded from pad three.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;31
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage174"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars, tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	PROJECT DEVELOPMENT REVIEW
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Pe&#241;asquito Project, Mexico
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<I>
	Pe&#241;asquito is a 100% owned development project consisting of two open pits, Pe&#241;asco and Chile
	Colorado. The mine is currently producing oxide and sulphide ore from the Pe&#241;asco pit. The oxide
	ore, which is ancillary to the primary operation, is directly hauled to a leach facility which
	commenced pre-commissioning production in the second quarter of 2008. The sulphide ore is hauled to
	both the line 1 mill (&#147;Line 1&#148;), which commenced pre-commissioning production in the fourth quarter
	of 2009, and to stockpiles. Upon completion of the construction of the line 2 mill (&#147;Line 2&#148;) and
	high pressure grinding rolls (&#147;HPGR&#148;), Pe&#241;asquito&#146;s processing facility will ramp up to a rate of
	130,000 tonnes per day. Following ramp-up, annual production over the life of mine (estimated at 22
	years) is expected to average approximately 500,000 ounces of gold, 31&nbsp;million ounces of silver and
	over 400&nbsp;million pounds of zinc. In December&nbsp;2009, new reserves were calculated using the latest
	exploration data and the deposit now contains 17.8&nbsp;million ounces of proven and probable gold
	reserves, 4.5&nbsp;million ounces of measured and indicated gold resources and 1.2&nbsp;million ounces of
	inferred gold resources. Pe&#241;asquito also contains 1,070.1&nbsp;million ounces of proven and probable
	silver reserves, 391.0&nbsp;million ounces of measured and indicated silver resources and 81.6&nbsp;million
	ounces of inferred silver resources. In addition, Pe&#241;asquito contains 7.2&nbsp;million and 15.9&nbsp;million
	pounds of proven and probable lead and zinc reserves, respectively, 2.7&nbsp;million and 9.1&nbsp;million
	pounds of measured and indicated lead and zinc resources, respectively, and 0.8&nbsp;million and 1.6
	million pounds of lead and zinc inferred resources, respectively.
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<I>
	Project status
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	On October&nbsp;13, 2009, the Company announced that the first lead and zinc concentrates were produced.
	Throughout its mine life, Pe&#241;asquito will produce both lead and zinc concentrates, with most of the
	gold and silver production coming from the lead concentrates. Initial concentrates were produced as
	a by-product of the commissioning process. Concentrate shipment to smelters commenced and first
	sales were recorded in November&nbsp;2009. All components of Line 1 are working as planned. Line 2
	construction remains on schedule for mechanical completion at the end of the second quarter of
	2010.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	As at December&nbsp;31, 2009, total project expenditures and commitments, excluding sustaining capital
	and pre-operating expenditures are $1.6&nbsp;billion, of which $1.5&nbsp;billion is spent and $88&nbsp;million is
	committed. Sustaining capital spent and pre-operating expenditures (oxide and sulphide
	expenditures, net of respective revenues) at December&nbsp;31, 2009 are $177.0&nbsp;million and $14.4
	million, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	The current capital estimate to mechanical completion remains at approximately 10% above the
	November&nbsp;2007 updated feasibility $1.49&nbsp;billion estimate, excluding sustaining capital and
	pre-operating expenditures.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	During 2009, several major milestones related to mining and processing facilities were achieved at
	Pe&#241;asquito:
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<I>
	Related to mining activities
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Fifty-seven (300-tonne) haul trucks and four electric shovels are operating at an average
	mining rate of approximately 500,000 tonnes per day. All mining equipment and permanent
	maintenance facilities are now in use.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Oxide ore continues to be hauled to the heap leach facility and sulphide ore is being
	hauled to the primary crusher or to stockpiles. The heap leach operation produced
	pre-commissioning production of 83,200 ounces of gold and 2.6&nbsp;million ounces of silver, with
	total costs of $18.3&nbsp;million ($25.1&nbsp;million project to date). These costs are capitalized and
	proceeds from sales during the pre-commissioning production phase are offset against
	capitalized mining costs. At December&nbsp;31, 2009, 9.2&nbsp;million tonnes of sulphide ore were
	stockpiled and an&nbsp;additional 2.0&nbsp;million tonnes were exposed in the pit and available for
	mining. The in-house RC drilling program continues to identify the ore type and quality ahead
	of mining.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;32
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
