<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 18PT">
<B>
	AUDITED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THE COMPANY FOR
<BR>
	THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2009, INCLUDING A RECONCILIATION TO
<BR>
	UNITED STATES GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Management&#146;s Responsibility for Financial Reporting
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	The accompanying consolidated financial statements have been prepared by management and are in
	accordance with Canadian generally accepted accounting principles. Other information contained in
	this document has also been prepared by management and is consistent with the data contained in the
	consolidated financial statements. A system of internal control is maintained by management to
	provide reasonable assurance that assets are safeguarded and financial information is accurate and
	reliable.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	The Board of Directors approves the financial statements and ensures that management discharges its
	financial responsibilities. The Board&#146;s review is accomplished principally through the audit
	committee, which is composed of non-executive directors. The audit committee meets periodically
	with management and the auditors to review financial reporting and control matters.
</DIV>

<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Report of Independent Registered Chartered Accountants
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	To the Shareholders of Goldcorp Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Goldcorp Inc. and its subsidiaries
	(the &#147;Company&#148;) as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008, and the related consolidated statements of
	earnings, cash flows, shareholders&#146; equity and comprehensive income for each of the three years in
	the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2009. These financial statements are the responsibility of the
	Company&#146;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements
	based on our audits.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight
	Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain
	reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An
	audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the
	financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and
	significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement
	presentation. We believe our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	In our opinion, such consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects,
	the financial position of Goldcorp Inc. and its subsidiaries as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008 and
	the results of their operations and their cash flows for each of the three years in the period
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 in conformity with Canadian generally accepted accounting principles.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	As discussed in Note 3 to the consolidated financial statements, the Company adopted Canadian
	Institute of Chartered Accountants Handbook Sections&nbsp;1530 &#151; Comprehensive Income, 3251 &#151; Equity,
	3855 &#151; Financial Instruments &#150; Recognition and Measurement, 3861 &#151; Financial Instruments &#150;
	Disclosure and Presentation and 3865 &#151; Hedges, effective January&nbsp;1, 2007.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	On March&nbsp;11, 2010, we reported separately to the Shareholders of Goldcorp Inc. that we have also
	audited, in accordance with Canadian generally accepted auditing standards, consolidated financial
	statements for the same periods, prepared in accordance with Canadian generally accepted accounting
	principles but which excluded the footnote providing a reconciliation of accounting principles
	generally accepted in Canada and the United States of America as it related to the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	We have also audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight
	Board (United States), the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31,
	2009, based on the criteria established in
<I>
	Internal Control&#151;Integrated Framework
</I>
	issued by the
	Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission and our report dated March&nbsp;11,
	2010 expressed an unqualified opinion on the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2010/03/19/0000950123-10-026345_X60364X6036408.GIF" ALT="(DELOITTE &#038; TOUCHE LLP)">
<BR>
<BR>
	Independent Registered Chartered Accountants
<BR>
	Vancouver, Canada
<BR>
	March&nbsp;11, 2010
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage204"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Management of Goldcorp Inc (&#147;Goldcorp&#148;) is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate
	internal control over financial reporting. Internal control over financial reporting is a process
	designed by, or caused to be designed under the supervision of, the President and Chief Executive
	Officer and the Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer and effected by the Board of
	Directors, management and other personnel to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability
	of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in
	accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. It includes those policies and procedures
	that:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	i.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	pertain to the maintenance of records that accurately and fairly reflect, in reasonable
	detail, the transactions and dispositions of assets of Goldcorp;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit
	preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting
	principles, and that Goldcorp receipts and expenditures are made only in accordance with
	authorizations of management and Goldcorp&#146;s directors; and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	iii.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized
	acquisition, use, or disposition of Goldcorp assets that could have a material effect on
	Goldcorp&#146;s financial statements.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	We have excluded from our assessment the internal control over financial reporting at Minera
	Alumbrera Limited (&#147;Alumbrera&#148;) in which we hold a 37.5% interest because we do not have the
	ability to dictate or modify controls at this entity and we do not have the ability to assess, in
	practice, the controls at the entity. Alumbrera constitutes 4% of total assets, 3% of net assets,
	20% of earnings from operations and 43% of net earnings of the consolidated financial statement
	amounts as of and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Due to its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or
	detect misstatements on a timely basis. Also, projections of any evaluation of the effectiveness of
	internal control over financial reporting to future periods are subject to the risk that the
	controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance
	with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Management assessed the effectiveness of Goldcorp&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2009, based on the criteria set forth in
<I>
	Internal Control &#150; Integrated Framework
</I>
	issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission. Based on this
	assessment, management believes that, as of December&nbsp;31, 2009, Goldcorp&#146;s internal control over
	financial reporting was effective.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	The effectiveness of Goldcorp&#146;s internal control over financial reporting, as of December&nbsp;31, 2009,
	has been audited by Deloitte &#038; Touche LLP, Independent Registered Chartered Accountants, who also
	audited the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, as
	stated in their report which appears on the following page.
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_64"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;

<!-- END TABLE HEAD -->

</DIV>
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2010/03/19/0000950123-10-026345_X60364O6035502.GIF" ALT="-S- LINDSAY HALL">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 1PX">

<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage205"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<B>
	Report of Independent Registered Chartered Accountants
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	To the Board of Directors and Shareholders of Goldcorp Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	We have audited the internal control over financial reporting of Goldcorp Inc. and its subsidiaries
	(the &#147;Company&#148;) as of December&nbsp;31, 2009, based on the criteria established in
<I>
	Internal
	Control&#151;Integrated Framework
</I>
	issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway
	Commission. As described in Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting,
	management excluded from its assessment the internal control over financial reporting at Minera
	Alumbrera Limited (&#147;Alumbrera&#148;), in which it holds a 37.5% interest and proportionally consolidates
	in the accompanying consolidated financial statements, because the Company does not have the
	ability to dictate or modify controls at this entity and does not have the ability to assess, in
	practice, the controls at the entity. Alumbrera constitutes 4% of total assets, 3% of net assets,
	20% of earnings from operations and 43% of net earnings of the consolidated financial statement
	amounts as of and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009. Accordingly, our audit did not include the
	internal control over financial reporting at Alumbrera. The Company&#146;s management is responsible
	for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting, and for its assessment of the
	effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, included in the accompanying
	Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting. Our responsibility is to express
	an opinion on the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting based on our audit.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	We conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight
	Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain
	reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was
	maintained in all material respects. Our audit included obtaining an understanding of internal
	control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, testing and
	evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk,
	and performing such other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe
	that our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	A company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting is a process designed by, or under the
	supervision of, the company&#146;s principal executive and principal financial officers, or persons
	performing similar functions, and effected by the company&#146;s board of directors, management, and
	other personnel to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting
	and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally
	accepted accounting principles. A company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting includes
	those policies and procedures that (1)&nbsp;pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable
	detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the
	company; (2)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit
	preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles,
	and that receipts and expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with
	authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance
	regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the
	company&#146;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Because of the inherent limitations of internal control over financial reporting, including the
	possibility of collusion or improper management override of controls, material misstatements due to
	error or fraud may not be prevented or detected on a timely basis. Also, projections of any
	evaluation of the effectiveness of the internal control over financial reporting to future periods
	are subject to the risk that the controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions,
	or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	In our opinion, the Company maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over
	financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2009, based on the criteria established in
<I>
	Internal Control
	&#151; Integrated Framework
</I>
	issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway
	Commission.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	We have also audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight
	Board (United States), the consolidated financial statements as of and for the year ended December
	31, 2009 of the Company and our report dated March&nbsp;11, 2010 expressed an unqualified opinion on
	those financial statements and included an explanatory paragraph regarding the Company&#146;s adoption
	of Canadian Institute of Chartered Accountants Handbook Sections&nbsp;1530 &#151; Comprehensive Income, 3251
	- Equity, 3855 &#151; Financial Instruments &#150; Recognition and Measurement, 3861 &#151; Financial Instruments
	&#150; Disclosure and Presentation and 3865 &#151; Hedges effective January&nbsp;1, 2007.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2010/03/19/0000950123-10-026345_X60364O6035503.GIF" ALT="(DELOITTE &#038; TOUCHE LLP)">
<BR>
<BR>
	Independent Registered Chartered Accountants
<BR>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_65"></A>
	Vancouver, Canada
<BR>
	March&nbsp;11, 2010
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3
</DIV>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage211"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL,NS -->
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
	Years Ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, 2008 and 2007
</FONT>
<BR>
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS AND NATURE OF OPERATIONS
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,BODY -->
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	Goldcorp Inc (&#147;Goldcorp&#148; or &#147;the Company&#148;) is a gold producer engaged in the operating,
	exploration, development and acquisition of precious metal properties in Canada, the United
	States, Mexico and Central and South America. The Company&#146;s current sources of operating cash
	flows are primarily from the sale of gold, copper and silver.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2009, the Company&#146;s producing mining properties were comprised of the Red Lake,
	Porcupine and Musselwhite gold mines in Canada; the San Dimas gold/silver and Los Filos and El
	Sauzal gold mines in Mexico; the Marlin gold/silver mine in Guatemala; the Alumbrera gold/copper
	mine (37.5% interest) in Argentina; and the Marigold (66.7% interest) and Wharf gold mines in
	the United States. Significant development projects include the Pe&#241;asquito gold/silver/zinc/lead
	and Noche Buena gold/silver projects in Mexico; the Cochenour, &#201;l&#233;onore and Hollinger gold
	projects in Canada; the Cerro Blanco gold/silver project in Guatemala; and the Pueblo Viejo gold
	project (40% interest) in the Dominican Republic. Goldcorp also owns a 65% interest in Terrane
	Metals Corp. (&#147;Terrane&#148;), a publicly traded company engaged in the development of the Mt.
	Milligan gold/copper project in Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	On December&nbsp;21, 2007, Goldcorp acquired Kinross Gold Corporation&#146;s 49% interest in the Porcupine
	gold mines in northeastern Ontario and 32% interest in the Musselwhite gold mine in northwestern
	Ontario in exchange for Goldcorp&#146;s 50% interest in the La Coipa gold/silver mine in Chile and
	cash
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	4(e)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	. As a result of this acquisition, Goldcorp&#146;s interest in the Porcupine and
	Musselwhite gold mines increased to 100%.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	On February&nbsp;14, 2008, Goldcorp disposed of its remaining 48% interest in Silver Wheaton Corp.
	(&#147;Silver Wheaton&#148;) with continuing involvement represented by its arrangements to sell silver
	produced from its San Dimas, Los Filos and Pe&#241;asquito mines to Silver Wheaton
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	4(d)
</I>
<I>
	).
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	During the first quarter of 2008, Goldcorp&#146;s 21% equity interest in Peak Gold Ltd. (&#147;Peak Gold&#148;)
	was reduced to 18% upon exercise of special warrants, at which time the investment was
	classified as available-for-sale and measured at fair value. On June&nbsp;30, 2008, Peak Gold
	completed a business combination with Metallica Resources Inc. and New Gold Inc. (&#147;New Gold&#148;)
	with the new combined company carrying on as New Gold. As a result, Goldcorp&#146;s investment in
	Peak Gold converted into a 7% ownership of New Gold
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	4(f)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	. On October&nbsp;13, 2009, Goldcorp
	disposed of its 7% interest in New Gold
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	15(a)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	On September&nbsp;25, 2008, Goldcorp acquired the net assets of Gold Eagle Mines Ltd. which includes
	a gold exploration project southwest of Goldcorp&#146;s Red Lake mines
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	4(c)
</I>
<I>
	).
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	On November&nbsp;16, 2009, Goldcorp entered into an agreement as amended on December&nbsp;23, 2009 and
	December&nbsp;29, 2009 with Canplats Resources Corporation (&#147;Canplats&#148;) to acquire Canplats, the
	owner of a 100% interest in the Camino Rojo gold/silver project in Mexico. This project is
	located approximately 50 kilometers southeast of Goldcorp&#146;s Pe&#241;asquito project in Mexico. The
	transaction completed on February&nbsp;4, 2010
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	24(a)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	On January&nbsp;7, 2010, Goldcorp entered into an agreement with New Gold whereby Goldcorp agreed to
	loan New Gold the funds needed by New Gold to acquire Xstrata Copper Chile S.A. (&#147;Xstrata&#148;)&#146;s
	70% interest in Sociedad Contratual Minera El Morro, the owner of the El Morro gold/copper
	project in Chile (&#147;the El Morro project&#148;). A subsidiary of New Gold exercised its right of first
	refusal pursuant to the El Morro Shareholders Agreement by notice to Xstrata and subsequently
	assigned its acquisition rights to another New Gold subsidiary. The acquisition of the 70%
	interest was completed on February&nbsp;16, 2010. Following this acquisition, Goldcorp acquired the
	New Gold subsidiary. As a result of these transactions, Goldcorp now holds a 70% interest in the
	El Morro project with the remaining 30% held by New Gold
<I>
	(note&nbsp;
</I>
<I>
	24(b)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage212"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	On February&nbsp;10, 2010, Goldcorp entered into an agreement with Gleichen Resources Ltd.
	(&#147;Gleichen&#148;) for the sale of Goldcorp&#146;s 21.2% interest in the Morelos gold project in Mexico.
	This transaction was completed on February&nbsp;24, 2010
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	24(c)
</I>
<I>
	).
</I>
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	2.

	&nbsp;

<!-- XBRL,BODY -->
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	These consolidated financial statements have been prepared by the Company in accordance with
	Canadian generally accepted accounting principles (&#147;Canadian GAAP&#148;) using the following
	significant accounting policies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Basis of presentation and principles of consolidation
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	These consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the Company and all of its
	subsidiaries. The principal mining properties of Goldcorp and their geographic locations at
	December&nbsp;31, 2009, are listed below:

<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;

<TD WIDTH="96">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The results of Goldcorp include a 51% and 68% interest in
	Porcupine and Musselwhite, respectively, which are proportionately
	consolidated from May&nbsp;12, 2006 to December&nbsp;21, 2007, and 100% interests which
	are consolidated thereafter
<I>
	(note 4(e)).
</I>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	Intercompany transactions and resulting balances with the Company&#146;s subsidiaries have
	been eliminated. Intercompany transactions and resulting balances with the Company&#146;s joint
	ventures have been eliminated to the extent of the Company&#146;s interests. There were no
	intercompany transactions and balances with the Company&#146;s equity method investees for the
	year ended and as at December&nbsp;31, 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	Variable interest entities (''VIE&#146;s&#146;&#146;), as defined by Accounting Guideline 15 -
<I>
	Consolidation of Variable Interest Entities
</I>
	are consolidated by the primary beneficiary who
	absorbs the majority of the entity&#146;s expected losses and/or expected residual returns. The
	Company has determined that none of the entities in which it has interests, which are not
	already consolidated as subsidiaries, qualify as VIE&#146;s.
</DIV>

<P>
<A NAME="eolPage213"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Use of estimates
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	The preparation of consolidated financial statements in conformity with Canadian GAAP
	requires that the Company&#146;s management make estimates and assumptions about future events
	that affect the amounts reported in the consolidated financial statements and related notes
	to the consolidated financial statements. Actual results may differ from those estimates.
	Estimates and assumptions are reviewed on an ongoing basis based on historical experience
	and other factors that are considered to be relevant under the circumstances. Revisions to
	estimates and assumptions are accounted for prospectively.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	Significant estimates and assumptions made in the preparation of these consolidated
	financial statements include, but are not limited to:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="16%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the recoverability of accounts receivable, income and
	mining taxes receivable, other receivables and investments;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="16%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the quantities of material on leach pads and in circuit
	and of recoverable gold in this material used in determining the estimated
	net realizable value of inventories;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="16%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	(iii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the economic recoverability of exploration costs
	incurred and the probability of future economic benefits from development
	costs incurred;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">

	(iv)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the recoverable tonnes of ore from each mine, the point
	at which operating levels intended by management are considered to be
	reached and related depreciation and depletion of mining interests;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>

	&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>

	(v)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>

	the proven and probable mineral reserves and resources
	associated with mining properties, the expected economic lives of mining
	properties, the future operating results and net cash flows from mining
	properties and the recoverability of mining properties;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">

</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(xii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the provision for income and mining taxes including
	expected periods of reversals of timing differences and composition of
	future income and mining tax assets and liabilities; and
