<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Silver Wheaton
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As a result of the acquisition of Wheaton River Minerals Ltd. (&#147;Wheaton&#148;) on February&nbsp;14,
	2005, Goldcorp acquired Wheaton&#146;s 65% ownership of its subsidiary, Silver Wheaton. Following
	various share issuances by Silver Wheaton, Goldcorp&#146;s interest in Silver Wheaton declined to
	49% at January&nbsp;1, 2007.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Additional share issuances by Silver Wheaton during 2007 from the exercise of stock options
	and warrants outstanding decreased Goldcorp&#146;s interest from 49% to 48% at December&nbsp;31, 2007
	and resulted in a dilution gain of $1.1&nbsp;million recognized in earnings during the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2007. The Company continued to consolidate Silver Wheaton in 2007 as it
	maintained control of Silver Wheaton due to the influence it exerted on the board of
	directors.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In the first quarter of 2008, prior to the disposition of Silver Wheaton shares on February
	14, 2008
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	4(d)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	, stock options, warrants and RSU&#146;s held by non-controlling interests
	were exercised and resulted in a 0.1% dilution in Goldcorp&#146;s interest and a dilution gain of
	$1.8&nbsp;million. The non-controlling interests&#146; share of Silver Wheaton&#146;s net earnings for 2008,
	prior to Goldcorp&#146;s disposition of its Silver Wheaton shares, amounted to $7.3&nbsp;million (year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 &#151; $47.0&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</TD>
<TD>
<I>
	Related party transactions:
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In the first quarter of 2008, prior to Goldcorp&#146;s disposition of its Silver Wheaton shares,
	Silver Wheaton purchased approximately 841,000 ounces (year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 &#151; 6.9
	million ounces) of silver from a Goldcorp subsidiary at a price of $3.95 per ounce for total
	consideration of approximately $3.3&nbsp;million (year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 &#151; $27.0&nbsp;million).
	Silver Wheaton also had an agreement with Goldcorp whereby the Company provided certain
	management and administrative services at cost. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008,
	total management fees paid to the Company were $0.1&nbsp;million (2007 &#151; $0.2&nbsp;million). This
	agreement was cancelled during the third quarter of 2008.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;44
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage247"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Terrane Metals Corp.
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On July&nbsp;24, 2006, the Company disposed of its interest in the Mt Milligan and certain other
	Canadian exploration interests to Terrane. In consideration for the exploration interests,
	the Company received 240&nbsp;million convertible Series&nbsp;A preferred shares at a price of C$0.50
	per share. The preferred shares are convertible into common shares of Terrane at the option
	of Goldcorp at any time without any further consideration. Upon acquisition, on an
	as-converted basis, Goldcorp would own an 81% equity interest in Terrane&#146;s issued and
	outstanding shares. The preferred shares are not entitled to dividends, are non-transferable
	without the prior written consent of Terrane, are non-redeemable, non-retractable, non-voting
	and if not previously converted will be automatically converted into common shares on the
	20th anniversary of their issuance.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Following the issuance of common shares and common share purchase warrants in a private
	placement on November&nbsp;3, 2006, Goldcorp&#146;s interest in Terrane declined to 77% at January&nbsp;1,
	2007.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On June&nbsp;21, 2007, Terrane closed a C$25&nbsp;million public offering of 30.8&nbsp;million common shares
	at a price of C$0.65 per share and 6.25&nbsp;million flow-through shares at a price of C$0.80 per
	share. On July&nbsp;23, 2007, Terrane closed a private placement of 5.6&nbsp;million common shares at a
	price of C$0.65 per share for gross proceeds of C$3.6&nbsp;million. These transactions resulted in
	a decrease in Goldcorp&#146;s interest in Terrane from 77% to 68%. This dilution of the Company&#146;s
	interest gave rise to an increase in non-controlling interests of $20.1&nbsp;million and a
	dilution gain of $8.9&nbsp;million.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During the third quarter of 2008, Terrane closed a private placement of 10.0&nbsp;million flow
	through common shares at a price of C$0.55 per share for gross proceeds of C$5.5&nbsp;million. The
	private placement in addition to issuances of common shares from exercises of stock options
	outstanding resulted in a decrease in Goldcorp&#146;s interest in Terrane from 68% to 66%. This
	dilution of the Company&#146;s interest, in addition to the renouncement of the income tax
	benefits relating to the flow through shares issued by Terrane in 2007, gave rise to an
	increase in non-controlling interests of $4.5&nbsp;million and a net dilution gain of $0.4
	million.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During the first quarter of 2009, Terrane renounced the income tax benefits relating to the
	C$5.5&nbsp;million flow through shares issued in the third quarter of 2008. The amount renounced
	is reduced from Terrane&#146;s share capital as share issue costs which resulted in a reversal of
	previously recorded dilution gains of $0.7&nbsp;million. During the fourth quarter of 2009,
	Terrane issued 4.8&nbsp;million common shares resulting from exercises of stock options and common
	share purchase warrants outstanding. This resulted in a decrease in Goldcorp&#146;s interest in
	Terrane from 66% to 65% and gave rise to an increase in non-controlling interests of $1.9
	million and a dilution gain of $0.4&nbsp;million. The non-controlling interests&#146; share of
	Terrane&#146;s net loss during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 was $2.0&nbsp;million (2008 &#151; share of
	net earnings of $0.4&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; share of net loss of $0.9&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	18.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	SHAREHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,BODY -->
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2009, the Company had unlimited authorized common shares and 733.6&nbsp;million
	common shares outstanding (2008 &#151; 729.6&nbsp;million). Refer to the Consolidated Statements of
	Shareholders&#146; Equity for movement in common shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Share purchase warrants
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008, the Company had a total of 9.2&nbsp;million warrants outstanding.
	Of the 9.2&nbsp;million warrants outstanding, 8.4&nbsp;million which were issued in 2006, entitle the
	holders to purchase at any time one common share of Goldcorp at an exercise price of C$45.75
	per share and expire on June&nbsp;9, 2011. These warrants are trading on the Toronto Stock
	Exchange (&#147;TSX&#148;) and New York Stock Exchange. The remaining 0.8&nbsp;million warrants which were
	issued by Goldcorp pursuant to the acquisition of Gold Eagle in 2008
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	4(c)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	, entitle
	holders to purchase at any time one common share of Goldcorp at an exercise price of C$34.76
	and expire on June&nbsp;26, 2011.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	There were no warrants exercised during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008. Warrants
	exercised during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 were nominal.
</DIV>
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company has a 2005 Stock Option Plan which allows for up to 32.5&nbsp;million stock options
	(2008 &#151; 32.5&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; 12.5&nbsp;million) with a maximum exercise period of five years (2008
	&#151; 5&nbsp;years; 2007 &#151; 10&nbsp;years) to be granted to employees and officers. Of the 14.1&nbsp;million
	stock options outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2009, 12.7&nbsp;million relate to options granted under
	the 2005 Stock Option Plan.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company granted 5.0&nbsp;million stock options during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 which
	vest over three years, are exercisable at C$35.62 to C$39.36 per option, expire in 2014 and
	have a total fair value of $49.9&nbsp;million at the date of grant. The Company granted 4.5
	million stock options during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008, which vest over a period of
	three years, are exercisable at C$39.77 per option, expire in 2013 and have a total fair
	value of $49.4&nbsp;million at the date of grant. The Company granted 3.9&nbsp;million stock options
	during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 which vest over a period of two years, are
	exercisable at prices ranging from C$24.40 to C$25.71 per option, expire in 2017 and have a
	total fair value of $22.7&nbsp;million at the date of grant.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	The expected volatility assumptions are based on the historical and implied volatility of
	Goldcorp&#146;s C$ common share price on the TSX. The risk-free interest rate assumptions are
	based on yield curves on Canadian government zero-coupon bonds with a remaining term equal to
	the stock options&#146; expected life. The fair value of the stock options is expensed over the
	periods in which the stock options vest. Options with graded vesting schedules are accounted
	for as separate grants with different vesting periods and fair values.
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 14PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	Restricted share units:
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	The Company has an RSU Plan which allows for up to 4.2&nbsp;million RSUs to be granted to
	employees and directors. Each RSU is exercisable into one common share for no additional
	consideration.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	The Company issued 369,000 RSUs during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 with a total fair
	value of $11.4&nbsp;million at the date of issuance, a portion of which vested immediately and the
	remaining portion vests over three years. The Company issued 406,500 RSUs during the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 (2007 &#151; 346,500) with a total fair value of $16.3&nbsp;million at the date
	of issuance (2007 &#151; $8.2&nbsp;million). These instruments vest over a period of up to three years
	from the date of issuance.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2009, the Company had 0.4&nbsp;million RSUs outstanding (2008 &#151; 0.4&nbsp;million; 2007
	&#151; 0.2&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	Stock options and Restricted share units:
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	Total stock options and RSUs vested during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 and credited to
	shareholders&#146; equity was $48.1&nbsp;million (2008 &#151; $40.4&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; $34.6). Of this amount,
	$3.0&nbsp;million (2008 and 2007 &#151; $nil) relates to the development of Pe&#241;asquito and is
	capitalized and included in the carrying amount of the mining property
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	9(c)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	. The
	remaining $45.1&nbsp;million (2008 &#151; $40.4&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; $34.6&nbsp;million) is recorded as stock
	based compensation expense and included in corporate administration. Total stock based
	compensation expense recognized during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007 of $42.6
	million and $41.2&nbsp;million, respectively, included $1.1&nbsp;million and $2.8&nbsp;million for Silver
	Wheaton, respectively, and $1.1&nbsp;million and $3.8&nbsp;million for Terrane, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Employee share purchase plan
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In July&nbsp;2007, the Company introduced an Employee Share Purchase Plan which allows Goldcorp
	employees in Canada to purchase the Company&#146;s common shares through payroll deductions.
	Employees may contribute up to 6% of their eligible
	earnings and the Company matches 50% of these contributions. Compensation expense,
	representing the Company&#146;s contributions measured based on the market price of the underlying
	common shares at the date of contribution, was $2.7&nbsp;million during the year ended December
	31, 2009 (2008 &#151; $2.5&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; $1.1&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	Prior to April&nbsp;1, 2005, the Canadian dollar (&#147;C$&#148;) was determined to be the measurement currency
	of the Company&#146;s Canadian operations and these operations were translated into US dollars until
	this date using the current rate method. Under this method, all assets and liabilities were
	translated into US dollars at the exchange rate prevailing at the balance sheet date, all
	revenue and expense items were translated at the average rate of exchange for the period and the
	resulting translation adjustment was recorded as a foreign exchange translation adjustment
	(&#147;FETA&#148;), a separate component of AOCI. The FETA balance at December&nbsp;31, 2009
	represents the cumulative translation adjustment to April&nbsp;1, 2005 and will remain in AOCI until
	the related foreign operation is disposed of.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;48
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage251"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	20.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	INTERESTS IN JOINT VENTURES
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,BODY -->
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	The Company conducts a portion of its business through joint ventures under which the
	venturers are bound by contractual arrangements establishing joint control over the ventures.
	The Company records its proportionate share of assets, liabilities, revenues, operating expenses
	and other income (expenses)&nbsp;of the joint ventures. At January&nbsp;1, 2007, the Company had interests
	in five joint ventures. On December&nbsp;21, 2007, the Company disposed of its interest in La Coipa
	and acquired full ownership interests in Porcupine and Musselwhite
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	4(e)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	, which reduced
	the number of its interests in joint ventures to two, Marigold and Alumbrera, as at December&nbsp;21,
	2007. There were no additions or changes to the number of joint ventures in which the Company
	had interests during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
	The following condensed statements of earnings and cash flows for the years ended December&nbsp;31
	and balance sheets at December&nbsp;31 detail the amounts relating to Goldcorp&#146;s interests in joint
	ventures that have been proportionately consolidated:
</DIV>

<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Includes the Company&#146;s proportionate share of Porcupine and Musselwhite&#146;s net earnings
	and cash flows to December&nbsp;21, 2007.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Excludes La Coipa, which has been reclassified as a discontinued operation
<I>
	(note 6)
</I>
	.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 3PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Included in total capital commitments at December&nbsp;31, 2009
<I>
	(note 15(b))
</I>
	are $0.9
	million relating to Alumbrera.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;49

	matters are outstanding from time to time. In the opinion of management, these matters will not

<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage255"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	24.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	SUBSEQUENT EVENTS
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,BODY -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Acquisition of Canplats Resources Corporation
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On November&nbsp;16, 2009, Goldcorp entered into an agreement as amended on December&nbsp;23, 2009 and
	December&nbsp;29, 2009 with Canplats to acquire all of the issued and outstanding common shares of
	Canplats for consideration of C$4.60 per common share outstanding at the closing date. This
	transaction completed on February&nbsp;4, 2010 for total consideration paid by the Company of
	C$295.6&nbsp;million ($275.4&nbsp;million) in cash. As a result of this transaction, Goldcorp now holds
	a 100% interest in the Camino Rojo gold/silver project in Mexico. This project is located
	approximately 50 kilometers southeast of Goldcorp&#146;s Pe&#241;asquito project in Mexico. This
	transaction will be accounted for as a business combination in accordance with Section&nbsp;1582
<I>
	(note 3)
</I>
	. Management is in the process of determining the fair values of identifiable assets
	and liabilities acquired. The resulting goodwill, if any, will be allocated to the Pe&#241;asquito
	reporting unit. Total estimated transaction costs that will be expensed in 2010 relating to
	the acquisition amount to $3.6&nbsp;million.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Acquisition of subsidiary of New Gold Inc.
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On January&nbsp;7, 2010, a subsidiary of New Gold exercised the right of first refusal pursuant to
	the El Morro Shareholders Agreement. The right of first refusal came into effect on October
	12, 2009 when Barrick Gold Corporation (&#147;Barrick&#148;) entered into an agreement with Xstrata to
	acquire Xstrata&#146;s 70% interest in Sociedad Contratual Minera El Morro, the owner of the El
	Morro project. Also on January&nbsp;7, 2010, Goldcorp entered into an agreement with New Gold
	whereby Goldcorp agreed to loan $463.0&nbsp;million to New Gold to fund the acquisition of
	Xstrata&#146;s 70% interest. Goldcorp also loaned $50.0&nbsp;million to a New Gold subsidiary which was
	paid to a different New Gold subsidiary in consideration of the internal assignment of the
	acquisition agreement with Xstrata. The acquisition of Xstrata&#146;s 70% interest by the New Gold
	subsidiary was completed on February&nbsp;16, 2010. Following this transaction, Goldcorp acquired
	the New Gold subsidiary. As a result of these transactions, Goldcorp now holds a 70% interest
	in the El Morro project with the remaining 30% held by New Gold.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Goldcorp, as the project operator, has agreed to fund, through interest bearing loans, New
	Gold&#146;s share of development and construction costs until intended operating levels are
	achieved. The amounts outstanding will be repaid to the Company during the production period
	of the El Morro project. The acquisition of the New Gold subsidiary will be accounted for as
	a business combination in accordance with Section&nbsp;1582
<I>
	(note 3)
</I>
	. Management is in the process
	of determining the fair values of identifiable assets and liabilities acquired. The El Morro
	project is considered a separate reporting unit for the purpose of allocating goodwill. Total
	estimated transaction costs that will be expensed in 2010 relating to the acquisition amount
	to $4.7&nbsp;million.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On January&nbsp;13, 2010, Goldcorp received a statement of claim filed by Barrick against
	Goldcorp, New Gold and certain of New Gold&#146;s subsidiaries, relating to the exercise of the
	right of first refusal by a New Gold subsidiary in respect of the El Morro project. The
	Company&#146;s management believes that Goldcorp has acted lawfully and appropriately in all
	aspects of this transaction and intends to defend Goldcorp against Barrick&#146;s claim.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Disposition of interest in the Morelos gold project
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On February&nbsp;10, 2010, Goldcorp entered into an agreement with Gleichen for the sale of
	Goldcorp&#146;s 21.2% interest in the Morelos gold project in Mexico (&#147;El Lim&#243;n) in exchange for
	C$52.0&nbsp;million in cash. This transaction was completed on February&nbsp;24, 2010. As a result of
	this transaction, the Company recognized a $17.3&nbsp;million after tax ($24.0&nbsp;million before tax)
	write-down of its investment in El Lim&#243;n during the fourth quarter of 2009
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	9(f)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;53

	&nbsp;

<EFX_INCOME_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_INCOME_STATEMENT_5"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;

</TABLE>

<!-- XBRL,BODY -->
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	A reconciliation of consolidated net earnings and comprehensive income determined in accordance
	with Canadian GAAP to consolidated net earnings and comprehensive income determined under generally
	accepted accounting principles in the United States (&#147;US GAAP&#148;) is as follows:
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,IN -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Consolidated Statements of Earnings and
<BR>
	Comprehensive Income
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,BODY -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="CENTER" COLSPAN="15">
<B>
	2009
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 14PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 4%">
<B>
	Differences between Canadian and US GAAP as they affect the Company&#146;s consolidated financial
	statements are as follows:
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Joint venture interests
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Under Canadian GAAP, the Company proportionately consolidates its interest in the
	incorporated joint venture of Alumbrera. The Company&#146;s interest in the La Coipa incorporated
	joint venture was proportionately consolidated in 2006 but was reclassified as a discontinued
	operation in 2007 as a result of its sale on December&nbsp;21, 2007
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	4(e)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	. Under US GAAP,
	the Company is required to equity account for these investments and records its proportionate
	share of net earnings in share of earnings of equity investees. Goldcorp&#146;s share of net
	earnings from Alumbrera amounted to $103.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 (2008
	&#151; $102.2&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; $166.4&nbsp;million). Goldcorp&#146;s share of net earnings from La Coipa for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 amounted to $38.3&nbsp;million.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Under Canadian GAAP, the Company proportionately consolidates its interest in the
	unincorporated joint venture of Marigold, and proportionately consolidated its interests in
	the Porcupine and Musselwhite unincorporated joint ventures up to December&nbsp;21, 2007 when full
	ownership interests were acquired
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	4(e)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	. US GAAP allows interests in unincorporated
	joint ventures in the natural resource industry to be accounted for by proportionate
	consolidation.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;59
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage262"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Operating levels intended by management
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Under Canadian GAAP, revenue recognition relating to the Company&#146;s mining operations begins
	when operating levels intended by management are achieved. The Company uses specific criteria
	to assess the point at which operating levels intended by management are achieved
<I>
	(note
	2(h))
</I>
	. Under US GAAP, revenue recognition begins when saleable minerals are extracted
	(produced)&nbsp;from an ore body, regardless of the level of production. However, revenue
	recognition does not commence with the removal of de minimus saleable mineral material that
	occurs in conjunction with the removal of overburden or waste material for the purpose of
	obtaining access to an ore body. As at December&nbsp;31, 2009 and for the year then ended, the
	Canadian/US GAAP differences with respect to operating levels intended by management versus
	commencement of production were as follows:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(i)&nbsp;Pe&#241;asquito project
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	According to Canadian GAAP, at December&nbsp;31, 2009, the mine has not reached the operating
	levels intended by management. Production commenced on February&nbsp;1, 2008. Accordingly, for US
	GAAP purposes the Company recognized revenues, operating expenses, and depreciation and
	depletion expense for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 in the amount of $121.8&nbsp;million,
	$211.2&nbsp;million and $128.3&nbsp;million, respectively (2008 &#151; $25.2&nbsp;million, $83.4&nbsp;million and
	$21.9&nbsp;million, respectively), and decreased net earnings for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009
	by $156.7&nbsp;million (2008 &#151; $57.7&nbsp;million). The balance sheet impact as at December&nbsp;31, 2009
	was to increase inventories by $37.8&nbsp;million (December&nbsp;31, 2008 &#151; $5.9&nbsp;million), decrease
	mining interests by $335.6&nbsp;million (December&nbsp;31, 2008 &#151; $86.0&nbsp;million), decrease future
	income and mining taxes by $83.4&nbsp;million (December&nbsp;31, 2008 &#151; $22.4&nbsp;million) and decrease
	opening retained earnings by $57.7&nbsp;million (December&nbsp;31, 2008 &#151; $nil).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(ii)&nbsp;Los Filos project
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	According to Canadian GAAP, the mine reached the operating levels intended by management on
	January&nbsp;1, 2008, while production commenced on March&nbsp;1, 2007. For US GAAP purposes, the
	impact of this difference was to increase net earnings for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007
	by $1.8&nbsp;million. At December&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2009, the balance sheet impact was to increase
	mining interests by $2.5&nbsp;million, decrease current future income and mining tax asset by $0.7
	million and increase opening retained earnings by $1.8&nbsp;million.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(iii)&nbsp;Red Lake underground expansion project
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	An expansion of the underground mine at Red Lake commenced in 2006. The #3 shaft production
	hoist and service cage was commissioned during the third quarter of 2007 and waste skipping
	and personnel movement commenced. However, due to a change in the project scope and the fact
	that the ventilation system was not functional until a later date, the shaft was not
	considered to be operating at the level intended by management for purposes of Canadian GAAP
	until January&nbsp;1, 2008. Under US GAAP, once an asset is in operation it is considered to be in
	use and should be depreciated. For US GAAP purposes, the impact of this difference was to
	increase depreciation and depletion expense for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 by $2.1
	million, decrease net earnings for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 by $1.4&nbsp;million, decrease
	mining interests and opening retained earnings at December&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2009 by $2.1&nbsp;million
	and $1.4&nbsp;million, respectively, and increase current future income and mining tax asset at
	December&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2009 by $0.7&nbsp;million.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Deferred stripping costs
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Under US GAAP, stripping costs incurred during the production phase of a mine are considered
	costs of sales and included in operating expenses in the period they are incurred. Therefore
	additions to the deferred stripping cost balance under Canadian GAAP are charged to earnings
	for US GAAP purposes as gold is produced and sold. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, this
	Canadian/US GAAP difference impacted the Pe&#241;asquito project, and the Alumbrera, Los Filos,
	and Wharf mines (2008 -
	Pe&#241;asquito project and the Alumbrera and Los Filos mines; 2007 &#151; Alumbrera mine). For the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009,
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;60
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage263"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the net effect of expensing stripping costs for US GAAP
	purposes, excluding the net effect relating to the Pe&#241;asquito project which is reflected in
	the US GAAP adjustments under note 25(b), was to reduce net earnings by $3.8&nbsp;million (2008 -
	$8.1&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; $9.0&nbsp;million), net of future income tax recovery of $0.2&nbsp;million (2008 -
	$0.4&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; $nil). Of the $3.8&nbsp;million charged to earnings during the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2009, $3.2&nbsp;million related to Alumbrera, which was recorded in share of earnings
	of equity investees (2008 &#151; $8.1&nbsp;million and $7.0&nbsp;million, respectively).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(d)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Stock options
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The accounting for share based compensation expense relating to stock options granted to
	employees is similar under Canadian and US GAAP with the exception noted below.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Stock options issued to employees of foreign operations, with an exercise price denominated
	in a currency other than the US dollar, the Company&#146;s functional currency, or the local
	currency of the foreign operation, are required under US GAAP to be classified as liabilities
	and fair valued each period. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, the net effect of
	accounting for these stock options as non-current derivative liabilities was to reduce net
	earnings by $0.6&nbsp;million (2008 &#151; $12.7&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; $10.0&nbsp;million). Non-current derivative
	liabilities at December&nbsp;31, 2009 relating to stock options issued to employees of foreign
	operations totaled $16.8&nbsp;million (December&nbsp;31, 2008 &#151; $31.6&nbsp;million), which was net of $15.5
	million (2008 &#151; $46.7&nbsp;million) reclassified to common shares relating to stock options
	exercised during the year then ended. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, stock options
	and additional paid in capital was decreased by $0.1&nbsp;million relating to the reversal of
	share based compensation expense recognized on options issued to employees of foreign
	operations under Canadian GAAP (2008 &#151; increased by $10.7&nbsp;million relating to the
	reclassification of $11.9&nbsp;million from non-current derivative liabilities for the change in
	status of certain employees, offset by the reversal of $1.2&nbsp;million of share based
	compensation expense recognized on options issued to employees of foreign operations under
	Canadian GAAP; 2007 &#151; decreased by $3.7&nbsp;million relating to the reversal of share based
	compensation expense recognized on options issued to employees of foreign operations under
	Canadian GAAP). The reversal of amounts reclassified to common shares on exercise of stock
	options under Canadian GAAP during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 amounted to $9.2&nbsp;million
	(2008 &#151; $13.4&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; $17.7&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The total intrinsic value of stock options outstanding and exercisable at December&nbsp;31, 2009,
	exclusive of options issued to employees of foreign operations, was $115.4&nbsp;million and $80.0
	million, respectively. The total intrinsic value of stock options exercised during the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 was $39.5&nbsp;million.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2009 there was $40.2&nbsp;million of total unrecognized compensation costs related
	to unvested stock options. These costs will be recognized over the weighted average period of
	2.5&nbsp;years. The following summarizes the changes in the Company&#146;s unvested stock options
	during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

	Under Canadian GAAP, exploration costs incurred to the date of establishing that a property
	is economically recoverable are charged to earnings. Further exploration and development
	expenditures are capitalized and included in the carrying amount of
</DIV>

<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;61

	&nbsp;

<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage264"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 14PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the related property.
	Under US GAAP, exploration and development costs incurred until the completion of a final
	feasibility study on the property are charged to earnings in the period they are incurred.
	Under US GAAP, $44.7&nbsp;million of such expenditures were expensed during the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2009, which resulted in a $31.8&nbsp;million, net of tax of $12.9&nbsp;million charge to
	earnings (2008 &#151; $173.7&nbsp;million, net of tax of $27.8&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; $53.0&nbsp;million, net of
	tax of $26.0&nbsp;million) principally arising from mining expenditures incurred relating to the
	Cochenour, &#201;l&#233;onore, Hollinger, Red Dot (included in Marigold), Cerro Blanco and certain
	Terrane development projects. Of the $173.7&nbsp;million and $53.0&nbsp;million of exploration and
	development costs expensed in 2008 and 2007, respectively, $96.3&nbsp;million, net of tax of $32.1
	million and $26.1&nbsp;million, net of tax of $8.7&nbsp;million, respectively, related to the Pueblo
	Viejo development project which was recorded in share of earnings of equity investees. Pueblo
	Viejo completed its final feasibility study on January&nbsp;1, 2009.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company incurred $61.2&nbsp;million of drilling and related costs during the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2009 (2008 &#151; $63.5&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; $64.2&nbsp;million) to convert mineral resources
	to reserves or to provide greater definition of existing reserves at properties that are
	either in the production or development stage that were capitalized. The Company acknowledges
	that there is diversity in interpretation and application of accounting practice within the
	mining industry with respect to the accounting treatment of such costs, in that some
	companies expense as incurred, the drilling and related costs incurred to define and
	delineate residual mineral deposits that have not been classified as proven and probable
	reserves at a development stage or production stage mine.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(f)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Flow-through shares
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Under Canadian GAAP, total proceeds from the issuance of flow-through shares are recorded as
	share capital upon receipt. Upon renouncement of income tax benefits, the estimated income
	tax benefits are treated as a cost of issuing equity and share capital is reduced.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Under US GAAP, total proceeds from the issuance of flow-through shares are allocated between
	the offering of shares and the sale of tax benefits. The amount allocated to the offering of
	shares is based on the quoted price of the underlying shares. The remaining amount which is
	allocated to the sale of tax benefits is recorded as a liability and is reversed when the tax
	benefits are renounced. The difference between the amount originally recorded as a liability
	and the estimated income tax benefits on date of renouncement is recognized as a gain or loss
	in earnings. For US GAAP purposes, the net effect was to decrease net earnings for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 by $0.2&nbsp;million (2008 and 2007 &#151; $nil), increase share capital at
	December&nbsp;31, 2009 by $1.3&nbsp;million (December&nbsp;31, 2008 &#151; decrease by $1.1&nbsp;million) and decrease
	current liabilities by $1.1&nbsp;million (December&nbsp;31, 2008 &#151; increase by $1.1&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(g)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Convertible senior notes
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For Canadian GAAP purposes, the Company has elected an accounting policy to expense
	transaction costs incurred relating to financial assets and liabilities, unless they are
	directly attributable to the acquisition or construction of qualifying assets
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	2(m)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	.
	Accordingly, the Company expensed the transaction costs allocated to the debt component of
	the convertible senior notes issued on June&nbsp;5, 2009
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	11(b)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	. Under US GAAP, debt issue
	costs are capitalized as an asset, separate from the related debt, and amortized over the
	term of the debt using the effective interest method. The impact of accounting for the
	transaction costs relating to the debt component of the convertible senior notes under US
	GAAP was to decrease finance fees by $16.6&nbsp;million, decrease future income tax recovery by
	$4.7&nbsp;million and increase net earnings by $11.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009
	and increase other non-current assets by $16.6&nbsp;million and increase future income tax
	liability by $4.7&nbsp;million as at December&nbsp;31, 2009.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(h)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Share purchase warrants
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For Canadian GAAP purposes, all of the Company&#146;s share purchase warrants are classified and
	accounted for as equity in the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements. In 2006, an
	interpretation of US GAAP, contained in the Financial Accounting
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;62

<P>
<A NAME="eolPage265"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 14PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Standards Board (&#147;FASB&#148;)&#146;s
	Accounting Standards Codification (&#147;ASC&#148;) 815 &#151;
<I>
	Derivatives and Hedging
</I>
	(&#147;ASC 815&#148;)
<I>
	,
</I>
	required
	that share purchase warrants with an exercise price denominated in a currency other than the
	Company&#146;s functional currency be classified and accounted for as financial liabilities and
	measured at fair value with changes in fair values included in net earnings. For the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, the net effect of reflecting the mark-to-market gain on these share
	purchase warrants was to increase net earnings by $21.7&nbsp;million (2008 &#151; $36.2&nbsp;million
	mark-to-market loss, net of non-controlling interests of $39.0&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; $66.2&nbsp;million
	mark-to-market loss, net of non-controlling interests of $111.8&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On September&nbsp;25, 2008, the Company acquired the net assets of Gold Eagle
<I>
	(notes
</I>
<I>
	4(c)
</I>
<I>
	and
	1
</I>
<I>
	8(a)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	for $1,286.8&nbsp;million. As part of its purchase price, the Company issued 0.8&nbsp;million
	share purchase warrants with an exercise price of C$34.76 per share. The amount reclassified
	to non-current derivative liabilities for these warrants was $8.0&nbsp;million. The offsetting
	$719.6&nbsp;million reclassification of warrants from non-current derivative liabilities to common shares related to the early exercise of the five existing series of warrants in March&nbsp;2006.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Non-current derivative liabilities relating to share purchase warrants with C$ exercise
	prices at December&nbsp;31, 2009 was $71.9&nbsp;million (December&nbsp;31, 2008 -$93.6&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(i)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Defined benefit pension plans
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	US GAAP requires an employer to recognize the overfunded or underfunded status of a defined
	benefit plan, other than a multi-employer plan, as an asset or liability, with changes in the
	funded status recognized as other comprehensive income. For US GAAP purposes, the net effect
	was to increase other comprehensive income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 by $1.3
	million (2008 &#151; increase by $3.0&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; decrease by $0.4&nbsp;million), decrease other
	long-term liabilities at December&nbsp;31, 2009 by $0.6&nbsp;million (December&nbsp;31, 2008 &#151; increase by
	$2.6&nbsp;million), increase future income and mining tax liability at December&nbsp;31, 2009 by $0.1
	million (December&nbsp;31, 2008 &#151; $0.8&nbsp;million) and increase AOCI at December&nbsp;31, 2009 by $0.5
	million (December&nbsp;31, 2008 -$1.8&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

	&nbsp;

	On February&nbsp;14, 2008, the Company disposed of its remaining 48% interest in Silver Wheaton
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	4(d)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	. In addition to the amounts recognized for Canadian GAAP purposes, the Company
	recorded additional accounting entries for US GAAP purposes to account for the disposition of
	its interest in Silver Wheaton which decreased goodwill by $21.5&nbsp;million, decreased
	non-current derivative liabilities by $562.5&nbsp;million and increased non-controlling interests
	by $266.0&nbsp;million. The $275.0&nbsp;million net additional gain on disposition of its interest in
	Silver Wheaton for US GAAP purposes was recognized as an additional $101.8&nbsp;million gain in
	the Company&#146;s 2008 consolidated statement of earnings and an additional $173.2&nbsp;million of
	excess consideration recorded in the Company&#146;s consolidated balance sheet.

<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 14PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;

<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For US GAAP purposes, these amounts are presented as deferred credit balances
	(non-current liabilities) on the Company&#146;s consolidated balance sheet. As sales of silver are
	made to Silver Wheaton under the terms of these silver arrangements, the deferred credit
	balances are amortized to revenues on a per ounce basis. The 2008 comparative figures have
	been reclassified to conform to the 2009 presentation.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">

	(k)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">

</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Investments in securities
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Under Canadian GAAP, upon adoption of the new Canadian accounting standards for financial
	instruments on January&nbsp;1, 2007
<I>
	(note 3)
</I>
	, the Company&#146;s investments in marketable and equity
	securities were classified as available-for-sale. Prior to this, a Canadian/US GAAP
	difference existed in the accounting for investments in marketable securities and equity
	securities, which under US GAAP would have been classified as trading securities and
	available-for-sale, respectively, and measured at fair value. The adjustment in 2007
	represents the impact of the classification of marketable securities under US GAAP as trading
	securities for the period prior to January&nbsp;1, 2007.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">

</TD>

<B>
	(l)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

</B>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Prior to 2004 and under Canadian GAAP, the Company used $70.6&nbsp;million of contributed surplus
	to eliminate a deficit which is not permitted under US GAAP. Also prior to 2004, for US GAAP
	purposes the Company reduced contributed surplus by $56.3&nbsp;million resulting from the
	amalgamation with another company.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	Prior to April&nbsp;1, 2005, the Canadian dollar was determined to be the functional currency of
	the Company&#146;s Canadian operations and these operations were translated into US dollars with
	the cumulative translation adjustment recorded in AOCI under both Canadian and US GAAP.
</DIV>

	Under US GAAP, a proportionate amount of the cumulative translation adjustment is not
	recognized in earnings when there is a reduction in the Company&#146;s net investment in a
	subsidiary as a result of dividend distributions.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In July&nbsp;2006, the FASB issued an interpretation of ASC 740 &#151;
<I>
	Income Taxes
</I>
	(&#147;ASC 740&#148;) which
	addresses the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes. This interpretation clarifies the
	accounting for income taxes by prescribing a minimum recognition threshold that a tax
	position is required to meet before being recognized in the financial statements. It also
	provides guidance on derecognition, classification, interest and penalties, accounting in
	interim periods, disclosures, and transition.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company adopted the provisions of ASC 740 with respect to the accounting for uncertainty
	in income taxes on January&nbsp;1, 2007. The adoption did not result in any adjustment to opening
	retained earnings for purposes of US GAAP.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;64
</DIV>

<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	As at December&nbsp;31, 2009, the Company had $153.7&nbsp;million of unrecognized tax benefits. If
	recognized, this amount would be recorded as an income tax recovery on the Consolidated
	Statements of Earnings and impact the reported effective tax rate. The Company does not
	expect the amount of unrecognized tax benefits to change significantly within the next twelve
	months.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	The Company recognizes interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits in income
	tax expense. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, the Company recognized $5.5&nbsp;million of
	interest and penalties (2008 &#151; $3.9&nbsp;million; 2007 &#151; $5.5&nbsp;million). The Company had $17.8
	million of interest and penalties accrued at December&nbsp;31, 2009 (December&nbsp;31, 2008 &#151; $12.3
	million).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	The Company is subject to income taxes in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Honduras,
	Argentina and various other foreign countries. The tax years of major tax jurisdictions which
	remain subject to examination as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 are as follows:
</DIV>

<B>
	United States accounting pronouncements adopted during 2007
