</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(i)
	Accounting for Certain Hybrid Financial Instruments
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	In February&nbsp;2006, the FASB issued a statement which amends ASC 815 and ASC 860 &#151;
<I>
	Transfers
	and Receivables
</I>
	. The amendments simplify accounting for certain hybrid financial instruments
	by permitting fair value remeasurements for any hybrid financial instrument that contains an
	embedded derivative that would otherwise require bifurcation, and eliminate the restriction
	on passive derivative instruments that a qualifying special purpose entity may hold, with any
	changes in fair value recognized in earnings. The amendments are effective for all financial
	instruments acquired or issued in the first fiscal year beginning after Sept. 15, 2006. The
	adoption of these amendments at January&nbsp;1, 2007 did not have a material impact on the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(ii)&nbsp;Accounting for Planned Major Maintenance Activities
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	In September&nbsp;2006, the FASB issued guidance which prohibits the use of the accrue-in-advance
	method of accounting for planned major maintenance activities in annual and interim financial
	statements, for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2006. The adoption and application
	of this guidance at January&nbsp;1, 2007 did not have a material impact on the Company&#146;s
	consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;65
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage268"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(q)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	United States accounting pronouncements adopted during 2008
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(i)&nbsp;Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	In September&nbsp;2006, the FASB issued ASC 820 &#151;
<I>
	Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures (&#147;ASC
	820&#148;)
</I>
	, effective for fiscal periods beginning after November&nbsp;15, 2007. ASC 820 defines fair
	value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value in generally accepted accounting
	principles, and expands disclosures about fair value measurements. In December&nbsp;2007, the FASB
	provided for a one-year deferral of the application of ASC 820 for non-financial assets and
	liabilities recognized or disclosed at fair value in the financial statements on a
	non-recurring basis. Also included in ASC 820 is guidance on measurement of fair value of a
	financial asset when the market of that financial asset is not active. The adoption of ASC
	820 during 2008, for financial assets and liabilities measured at fair value, did not have a
	material impact on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(ii)&nbsp;Fair Value Option
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	In February&nbsp;2007, the FASB issued guidance on the fair value option for financial assets and
	financial liabilities which is included in ASC 825 &#151;
<I>
	Financial Instruments
</I>
	and permits
	entities to choose to measure many financial instruments and certain other items at fair
	value. This statement is effective for fiscal periods beginning after November&nbsp;15, 2007. The
	adoption and application of this guidance at January&nbsp;1, 2008 did not have a material impact
	on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(r)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	United States accounting pronouncements adopted during 2009
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(i)&nbsp;Financial Accounting Standards Board&#146;s Codification of US GAAP
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	On July&nbsp;1, 2009, the FASB&#146;s Codification of US GAAP was launched as the sole source of
	authoritative non-governmental US GAAP. The Accounting Standards Codification is not intended
	to change US GAAP, but rather reorganize existing guidance by accounting topic to allow
	easier identification of applicable standards. References in the Company&#146;s consolidated
	financial statements to US GAAP have been updated to reflect the Codification.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(ii)&nbsp;Business Combinations and Non-Controlling Interests
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	In December&nbsp;2007, the FASB issued ASC 805 &#151;
<I>
	Business Combinations (&#147;ASC 805&#148;)
</I>
	and ASC 810 -
<I>
	Non-controlling Interests in Consolidated Financial Statements (&#147;ASC 810&#148;)
</I>
	, which are both
	effective for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2008.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	ASC 805, which replaces SFAS 141 &#151;
<I>
	Business Combinations (&#147;SFAS 141&#148;)
</I>
	, is applicable to
	business combinations consummated after the effective date of December&nbsp;15, 2008. Under ASC
	805, business combinations are accounted for under the &#147;acquisition method&#148;, compared to the
	&#147;purchase method&#148; previously required by SFAS 141. The significant changes that will result
	from applying the acquisition method of ASC 805 include: (i)&nbsp;the definition of a business is
	broadened to include development stage entities, and therefore more acquisitions are
	accounted for as business combinations rather than asset acquisitions; (ii)&nbsp;the measurement
	date for equity interests issued by the acquirer is the acquisition date instead of a few
	days before and after terms are agreed to and announced, which may significantly change the
	amount recorded for the acquired business if share prices differ from the agreement and
	announcement date to the acquisition date; (iii)&nbsp;all future adjustments to income tax
	estimates are recorded as income tax expense or recovery, whereas under SFAS 141, certain
	changes in income tax estimates were recorded to goodwill; (iv)&nbsp;acquisition-related costs of
	the acquirer, including investment banking fees, legal fees, accounting fees, valuation fees,
	and other professional or consulting fees are expensed as incurred, whereas under SFAS 141,
	these costs were capitalized as part of the cost of the business combination; (v)&nbsp;the assets
	acquired and liabilities assumed are recorded at 100% of fair value even if less than 100% is
	obtained, whereas under SFAS 141, only the controlling interest&#146;s portion was recorded at
	fair value; and (vi)&nbsp;non-controlling interests are recorded at their share of fair value of
	net assets
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;66
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage269"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	acquired, including their share of goodwill, whereas under SFAS 141, non-controlling
	interests were recorded at their share of carrying value of net assets acquired with no
	goodwill being allocated.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	Under ASC 810, non-controlling interests are measured at 100% of the fair value of assets
	acquired and liabilities assumed. For presentation and disclosure purposes, non-controlling
	interests are classified as a separate component of shareholders&#146; equity. In addition, ASC
	810 changes the manner in which increases and decreases in ownership percentages are
	accounted for. Changes in ownership percentages are recorded as equity transactions and no
	gain or loss is recognized as long as the parent retains control of the subsidiary. When a
	parent company deconsolidates a subsidiary but retains a non-controlling interest, the
	non-controlling interest is re-measured at fair value on the date control is lost and a gain
	or loss is recognized at that time. Under ASC 810, accumulated losses attributable to
	non-controlling interests are no longer limited to the original carrying amount, and
	therefore non-controlling interests could have a negative carrying amount. The provisions of
	ASC 810 have been applied prospectively with the exception of the presentation and disclosure
	provisions, which have been applied for all prior periods presented in the financial
	statements. The presentation and disclosure provisions resulted in the reclassification of
	dilution loss of $0.3&nbsp;million from net earnings to non-controlling interests and
	non-controlling interests to the equity section of the balance sheet totaling $50.8&nbsp;million
	as at December&nbsp;31, 2009 (December&nbsp;31, 2008 &#151; $51.2&nbsp;million).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(iii)&nbsp;Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	During 2009, the FASB issued guidance, included in ASC 820, on determining the fair value of
	a financial asset and liability when the volume and level of activity for the asset or
	liability has significantly decreased. This guidance is applicable for interim and annual
	periods ending after June&nbsp;15, 2009. In addition, the FASB issued additional guidance on
	determining the fair value of liabilities, including the incorporation of non-performance
	risks, market participant assumptions and the impact of restrictions on transfers in the fair
	value measurement inputs.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	The adoption of the above guidance did not have a material impact on the Company&#146;s
	consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(iv)&nbsp;Convertible Debt
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	Effective January&nbsp;1, 2009, the Company adopted the FASB&#146;s guidance on accounting for
	convertible debt instruments that may be settled in cash or partial cash settlement upon
	conversion, included in ASC 470 &#151;
<I>
	Debt
</I>
	and applicable for fiscal years beginning after
	December&nbsp;15, 2008. This guidance requires similar initial recognition and measurement and
	subsequent measurement of the Company&#146;s convertible senior notes as Canadian GAAP.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(v)&nbsp;Derivative Instruments
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	Effective January&nbsp;1, 2009, the Company adopted the FASB&#146;s guidance on determining whether an
	instrument is indexed to an entity&#146;s own stock which is included in ASC 815 and applicable
	for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2008. Derivative instruments that are indexed
	to an entity&#146;s own stock are exempt from classification as liabilities and would instead be
	classified as equity. Equity-linked financial instruments with a strike price denominated in
	a currency other than the issuer&#146;s functional currency would not be considered indexed to the
	entity&#146;s own stock. The adoption of this guidance did not result in a material impact to the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	Also effective January&nbsp;1, 2009, the Company adopted the FASB&#146;s standard on disclosures about
	derivative instruments and hedging activities included in ASC 815 and applicable for interim
	and fiscal years beginning after November&nbsp;15, 2008. The standard amends and expands the
	disclosure requirements to provide users of financial statements with an enhanced
	understanding of how and why an entity uses derivative instruments, how derivative
	instruments are accounted for and how derivative instruments affect an entity&#146;s financial
	position and financial performance. The requirements of this standard are similar to those
	under Canadian GAAP.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	GOLDCORP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;67
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	&nbsp;
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage270"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: .25IN; WIDTH: 7.20IN">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
	(in United States dollars and tabular amounts in millions, except where noted)
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(vi)&nbsp;Equity method investees
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	Effective January&nbsp;1, 2009 the Company adopted the FASB&#146;s guidance on equity method investment
	accounting considerations which is included in ASC 323 &#151;
<I>
	Investments &#151; Equity Method and
	Joint Ventures
</I>
	and applicable for fiscal years beginning on or after December&nbsp;15, 2008. The
	guidance indicates when investments accounted for using the equity method are impaired and
	the appropriate initial measurement and accounting for subsequent changes in ownership
	percentages. The adoption of this guidance did not result in a material impact to the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	(vii)&nbsp;Subsequent events
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 8%">
	In 2009, the Company adopted ASC 855, as amended on February&nbsp;24, 2010, the FASB&#146;s guidance on
	subsequent events which is applicable for interim and annual periods ending after June&nbsp;15,
	2009 on a prospective basis. The guidance requires that the Company evaluate subsequent
	events through the date the financial statements are issued. The adoption of this guidance
	did not result in a material impact to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	(s)
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	United States accounting pronouncements proposed to be implemented effective January&nbsp;1,
	2011
</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On December&nbsp;17, 2009, the FASB issued a proposed Accounting Standard Update (&#147;ASU&#148;) which
	addresses the impact of denominating the exercise price of a share based payment in the
	currency of the market in which the underlying equity security trades. The ASU proposes an
	exception to the liability classification which applies to an entity&#146;s share based payments
	with exercise prices denominated in the currency of the market in which substantial portions
	of the entity&#146;s equity securities trade. In the event that the proposed ASU is approved into
	a final standard, the standard which would be effective for interim and annual periods
	beginning on or after December&nbsp;15, 2010 and applied prospectively, would result in a
	reclassification of stock options issued by the Company to employees of its foreign
	operations, with an exercise price denominated in other than US dollars or the local currency
	of the foreign operation
<I>
	(note
</I>
<I>
	25(h)
</I>
<I>
	)
</I>
	from non-current derivative liabilities to
	shareholders&#146; equity. The Company plans to adopt IFRS effective January&nbsp;1, 2011 which
	requires that all stock based compensation awarded to employees be classified as equity.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage272"></A>
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_99>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_99_4"></A>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Exhibit&nbsp;99.4
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 76PT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2010/03/19/0000950123-10-026345_X60364X6036400.GIF" ALT="(GOLDCORP LOGO)">
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 20PT; MARGIN-TOP: 48PT">
<B>
	CODE OF CONDUCT
</B>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage273"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 2 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<!-- TOC -->
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_TOCPAGE">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 18PT">
	Message from Charles A. Jeannes,
<BR>
	PRESIDENT, GOLDCORP INC.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
<I>
	Ethics from the ground up.
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Goldcorp is committed to delivering responsible, sustainable growth to all stakeholders in a
	manner that maintains and enhances confidence and trust in our integrity and meets or exceeds
	industry standards for corporate governance, ethical behaviour and best practices. Achieving our
	goals requires commitment and dedication from each and every one of our directors, officers, and
	employees and the agents, consultants, contractors and sub-contractors who are hired to work on
	behalf of Goldcorp.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Integrity is the foundation on which Goldcorp builds its success, enhances stakeholder value, and
	contributes to sustainable growth in the communities in which we operate. Our integrity as an
	organization depends on how each of us acts. We would like to take this opportunity to thank each
	of you for your commitment to acting with integrity as you do your job as a member of Goldcorp.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Our Code of Conduct governs how we deal with each other and with the individuals, communities,
	organizations, and businesses with whom we do business. These rules are meant to guide us on the
	job and to make sure that Goldcorp is always a place where we are proud to work.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The following statements form the basis of our Code which Goldcorp believes will result in our
	achieving Goldcorp&#146;s commitment to act with integrity.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Integrity starts &#147;from the ground up&#148; and is a part of everything we do.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Every Goldcorp employee has a duty to report violations of this Code and has a
	right to expect that Goldcorp will not retaliate against or punish an employee who in
	good faith reports a violation of the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	We recognize that our Code cannot deal with every possible situation we
	encounter in performing our jobs and that no one is expected to always know the right
	answer. So if you are in a situation where you are unsure if the Code applies, or are
	uncertain how to comply with the Code, ask for help. You can call or send an email to
<B>
	Ethics Help
</B>
	at 604.699.0410 or
<U>
	ethics.help@goldcorp.com
</U>
	for guidance. If you prefer to
	seek advice anonymously, you can contact our Anonymous Compliance Hotline (see the
	contact information at page 18 of this Code) in confidence where you will speak to an
	independent service firm who will refer your question or concern anonymously to
	Goldcorp for response or investigation.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Part&nbsp;1 of the Code sets out general guidelines applicable to everyone who is employed by or
	provides goods or services to Goldcorp. Part&nbsp;2 provides guidelines for dealing with specific
	situations that some of us may encounter in the course of our work. Part&nbsp;3 describes procedural
	and administrative matters, including procedures for reporting and evaluating potential violations
	of the Code.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	It is important to remember that Code of Conduct violations will be investigated and may result in
	disciplinary actions including dismissal.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In addition to the Code, we are extremely proud of Goldcorp&#146;s Six Strategies and our commitment to
	corporate social responsibility and to follow voluntary industry codes, standards and initiatives
	that recognize the importance of promoting and protecting human rights, responsible management, and
	sustainable prosperity. We encourage everyone to learn more about the Six Strategies and our
	voluntary commitments as described on Goldcorp&#146;s website.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<I>
	/s/ Charles A. Jeannes
</I>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>

<!--A HREF="#102"-->
	Compliance with the Code
<!--/A-->
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT">
	4
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage275"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 4 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_101">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	PART 1 &#150; COMMITMENTS APPLICABLE TO ALL
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Part&nbsp;1 of the Code sets out ethical commitments applicable to everyone who is employed by
	Goldcorp.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_102">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Compliance with the Code
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Our commitment to integrity starts &#147;from the ground up&#148; and is part of everything we do.
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Read and fully comply with the portions of the Code that are relevant to their
	job duties (including any significant changes to the Code) and ask questions if they
	are uncertain about their responsibilities under the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	If asked to help, provide assistance with compliance audits for the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always report violations of the Code as required by the Code (see procedures in
	Part&nbsp;3).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_103">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Compliance with Laws
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Goldcorp requires and expects everyone to comply with all applicable laws in performing work
	for Goldcorp. Violating the laws of any country where Goldcorp does business may lead to
	both disciplinary measures under the Code and civil or criminal liability for the Company
	and the person involved.
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always fully comply with all laws that apply to their job duties (including the
	laws of countries other than the country in which they work, if applicable).
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always ask questions if the requirements of any law are unclear.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never commit or condone an illegal act or authorize others, such as contractors
	or agents, to act illegally.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always avoid acting in a manner that could lead others to question Goldcorp&#146;s
	commitment to complying with all applicable laws.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_104">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Compliance with Accounting Procedures
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	The integrity of the Company&#146;s financial record keeping systems will be respected at all
	times.
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always promptly provide any information necessary to ensure that Goldcorp&#146;s
	records are accurate, fair, timely, complete and understandable.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never use or authorize accounting practices, such as falsified books, secret
	accounts or slush funds, that could distort Goldcorp&#146;s operating results or performance
	measures.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage276"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 5 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_105">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Employee Relations, Harassment and Anti-Discrimination
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Goldcorp strives to foster an open and inclusive workplace environment and strongly supports
	the principle that all individuals should have an equal opportunity to participate in our
	company and achieve their full potential.
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always treat each other and all members of the outside community with respect
	and courtesy.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always keep our workplace free from all forms of harassment, meaning unwelcome
	behaviour that a reasonable person would consider to be degrading, humiliating,
	discriminatory, or intimidating.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never permit factors like race, religion, colour, sex, sexual orientation, age,
	nationality or ethnicity to determine decisions about hiring, employment promotions,
	pay rates, transfers, lay-offs or terminations (or condone decisions by others
	determined by such factors).
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never permit physical disabilities to determine work-related decisions, unless
	the disability prevents a person from safely doing a job and the disability cannot
	reasonably be accommodated.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_106">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Fitness for Work
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Goldcorp is committed to making sure its workplaces are &#147;Safe Enough for Our Families&#148; and
	encourages anyone who is not fit for work to advise their supervisor and seek help so that
	their job performance or the safety of co-workers is not jeopardized.
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always ensure that they are fit for work, and will make the appropriate
	arrangements if over the counter or prescription medicines may impair their ability to
	work safely.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never report to work under the influence of illegal drugs or alcohol. Illegal
	drugs are drugs the law prohibits an individual to possess or use. Illegal drugs
	include prescription drugs, if possessed or used by someone without a proper
	prescription.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always comply with site specific policies regarding the possession of alcohol.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never possess or use, buy, or sell illegal drugs.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always make arrangements for safe transportation when consuming alcohol at a
	Company sanctioned function.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(f)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never drive while under the influence of alcohol.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage277"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 6 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_107">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	6.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Protection and Personal Use of Goldcorp Assets
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Goldcorp encourages actions that safeguard our assets and ensure they are not used
	wastefully.
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always use Goldcorp&#146;s assets only for Goldcorp-related business purposes.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always limit personal use of Goldcorp&#146;s assets (e.g., computers and software,
	email, telephones, BlackBerries
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	TM
</SUP>
	, internet and other electronic systems,
	vehicles) to incidental, reasonable amounts (i.e. personal use must not interfere with
	the ability to properly perform job duties) and use other Goldcorp assets for personal
	activities only if authorized by your employment contract.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always exercise prudence in incurring and approving business expenses, work to
	minimize such expenses and ensure that such expenses are reasonable and serve
	Goldcorp&#146;s business interests.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never steal, damage, misuse or waste Goldcorp assets (including cash, cheques,
	documents, proprietary information, supplies, materials, and equipment).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_108">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	7.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Fraud or Bribery
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Goldcorp&#146;s commitment to integrity includes a commitment not to engage in or tolerate fraud
	or bribery. Fraud is an intentional act or omission designed to deceive another person or
	to obtain a benefit that one is not entitled to. Bribery is an intentional offer of
	monetary or other benefit to another person, government official, organization, or company
	in order to secure or to attempt to secure a benefit in the performance of a duty, to obtain
	or retain business, or to obtain any other improper advantage in conducting our business.
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Fraud can include a wide range of activities, such as falsifying records or timesheets,
	creating false benefits claims and misappropriating Goldcorp assets (including both physical
	assets and non-physical assets such as proprietary information and corporate opportunities)
	for personal gain.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Bribery can take different forms, such as cash payments; employment; bartering transactions;
	directing business to a particular individual or business; undue hospitality; or providing
	services or other benefits to a person, organization, or company or to those related to a
	particular person, organization, or company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never engage in fraudulent activities in the course of their work.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never bribe, offer a bribe, or condone bribery by others in the course of their
	work.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always ensure that Goldcorp&#146;s assets are used only for legitimate business
	purposes and that all contracts for goods and services are made at a rate that reflects
	reasonable market conditions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage278"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 7 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_109">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	8.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Recordkeeping and Retention
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Information created or received in any format (paper, electronic, digital, audio-visual, or
	graphic) in the usual and ordinary course of business is Goldcorp&#146;s property. Goldcorp is
	committed to creating, managing, storing, retrieving, and destroying the Company&#146;s records
	so as to facilitate the efficient conduct of the Company&#146;s business.
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always make sure that Goldcorp records (including correspondence, memoranda,
	reports, presentations, safety documents, monitoring data, electronic databases, and
	financial records) are clear, truthful, complete, accurate, professional, and free from
	inappropriate or extraneous remarks.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always retain Goldcorp records as required by law, Goldcorp&#146;s Record Management
	Policy or as notified by Goldcorp legal personnel.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always maintain the confidential and proprietary nature of Goldcorp information
	and records.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always return Goldcorp records to an immediate supervisor upon changing
	positions or ceasing employment with Goldcorp.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never destroy, alter, or render unreadable Goldcorp records unless expressly
	authorized to do so in compliance with Goldcorp&#146;s Record Management Policy.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_110">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	9.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Communicating with the Media and Other Members of the Public
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Goldcorp is committed to providing, timely, factual, accurate, and complete disclosure of
	material information to shareholders and investors, and to the communities in which we
	conduct business.
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always comply with Goldcorp&#146;s Timely Disclosure, Confidentiality and Insider
	Trading Policy (the &#147;Disclosure Policy&#148;) which sets out our policies regarding public
	disclosure and identifies who can speak with the media on behalf of the Company and
	under what circumstances. All authorized spokespersons and employees with
	responsibilities related to public disclosure must thoroughly understand their
	obligations under the Disclosure Policy.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 18PT">
<B>
	To view the Timely Disclosure, Confidentiality and Insider Trading Policy go to:
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	www.goldcorp.com/_resources/corporate_governance/timely_disclosure_insider_trading_policy.pdf
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Printed copies of the Timely Disclosure, Confidentiality and Insider Trading
	Policy are available from Conveyor, your supervisor, or the Ethics Help at
<U>
	ethics.help@goldcorp.com
</U>
	or Goldcorp Inc., c/o Ethics Help, Suite&nbsp;3400-666
	Burrard Street, Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, V6C 2X8.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	If practical, normal course inquiries about Goldcorp&#146;s business or affairs from
	the media or other members of the public should be referred to Goldcorp&#146;s Vice
	President, Investor Relations at 604.696.3000.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage279"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 8 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never make comments to the media or a member of the public in a manner that
	leads others to believe that you are speaking on behalf of Goldcorp, unless expressly
	authorized to do so and in compliance with the Disclosure Policy.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_111">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	10.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Political Activities and Donations
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Goldcorp encourages everyone to participate in political activities on their own time and at
	their own expense. Goldcorp will engage governments responsibly with respect to policy
	matters that are relevant to its business. However, because laws in certain jurisdictions
	prohibit or regulate corporate donations to political parties, politicians, or a candidate
	for public office, Goldcorp&#146;s policy is that all contributions to political parties,
	politicians, or a candidate for public office must be approved in advance by Goldcorp&#146;s
	Board of Directors, Chief Executive Officer, or an Executive Vice President.
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never contribute funds or authorize the contribution of funds by or in the name
	of Goldcorp to any political party, politician, or candidate for public office at any
	level of government (local, regional, or national) in any country without the prior
	approval of Goldcorp&#146;s Board of Directors, Chief Executive Officer, or an Executive
	Vice President. In making any such contributions, Goldcorp will endeavour to avoid
	circumstances in which Goldcorp appears to be publicly supporting a particular
	candidate or political party (e.g., use of Goldcorp name or logo in promotional
	material or event signage). This policy also applies to payments to charities, lobbying
	firms, research institutes, or other organizations which represent or direct funds to a
	political party, politician, or candidate for public office.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always seek approval of Goldcorp&#146;s Board of Directors, Chief Executive Officer,
	or Executive Vice President before purchasing for or in the name of Goldcorp admission
	to or seats at a conference, breakfast, lunch, dinner, or any other event organized by
	or on behalf of a political party, politician, or candidate for public office for which
	a fee is paid or contribution required. Goldcorp will participate in such events only
	where justified by a legitimate business purpose.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never do anything at work that would interfere with a person&#146;s right to choose
	to volunteer for political causes or contribute to political parties in their personal
	capacity.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always make it very clear when participating in political activities,
	especially when speaking to the media or other community members, that you are acting
	in a strictly personal capacity, not on Goldcorp&#146;s behalf.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never use Goldcorp materials, for example stationery, email, facilities or
	funds, when engaged in personal political activities.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(f)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always seek guidance from the Ethics Help at
<U>
	ethics.help@goldcorp.com
</U>
	or 604 699.0410, if you have any doubt about your participation in political activities
	or contributions to political fund raising.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(g)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always ensure that your participation in and financial support of political
	activities is fully compliant with the
<B>
	Foreign Corrupt Practices Act
</B>
	of the United
	States of America and the
<B>
	Corruption of Foreign Public Officials Act
</B>
	of Canada. If you
	have any questions regarding the requirements or application of these laws, you must
	seek guidance from Ethics Help at
<U>
	ethics.help@goldcorp.com
</U>
	or 604 699.0410.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage280"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 9 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_112">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	11.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Charitable Contributions
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Goldcorp recognizes the importance of contributing to the communities in which it operates,
	and provides support to a wide variety of initiatives through donations and the sponsorship
	of various events. Goldcorp&#146;s policy is to give a percentage (as determined annually and
	approved by the Board) of pre-tax income to charitable endeavours.
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always comply with the procedures set out in Goldcorp&#146;s Donation Policy when
	making a charitable donation on Goldcorp&#146;s behalf.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Goldcorp&#146;s Donation Policy is available on Conveyor or from your supervisor or the Ethics
	Help at
<U>
	ethics.help@goldcorp.com
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_113">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	12.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Reporting Violations of the Code
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Employees, directors and officers have a duty to report suspected Code violations. They are
	also responsible for helping to identify and raise potential issues before they lead to Code
	violations
</I>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always report suspected Code violations or situations that may create a potential
	for Code violations are reported to the appropriate levels of management and the Audit
	Committee of the Board of Directors as provided in Part&nbsp;3 of this Code.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always act in good faith in reporting a suspected Code violation or a situation
	that may create a potential for a Code violation.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Never take any action (including termination, demotion, suspension, transfer,
	threaten or harass) against:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	a person who in good faith reports a suspected Code violation
	or a situation that may create a potential for a Code violation; or
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="10%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	a person who cooperates with the investigation of a suspected
	Code violation or a situation that may create a potential for a Code violation
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	based solely on the fact that the person acted as provided in (i)&nbsp;or
	(ii)&nbsp;above.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage281"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 10 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_114">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	PART 2 &#150; SPECIFIC SITUATIONS
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
<I>
	Part&nbsp;2 of this Code describes how to deal with specific situations that some of us will
	encounter in the course of our work. Not all situations that may involve issues of integrity or
	ethics are described in this section. Goldcorp endeavours to promote an open and positive work
	environment and encourages you to address any questions regarding the best course of action in a
	particular situation or concerns about a possible violation of a law, regulation or the Code
	promptly with your local management or as directed in Part&nbsp;3, Section&nbsp;A.2(a) of the Code.
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_115">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Agents, Consultants, Contractors and Sub-Contractors
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Goldcorp expects our agents, consultants, contractors and sub-contractors to comply with
	Goldcorp&#146;s Code of Conduct in providing services to Goldcorp.
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Directors, officers and employees will:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always perform background checks on the reputations and business practices of
	agents, consultants and contractors.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always draft agreements with agents, consultants or contractors that include
	terms:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="8%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	requiring compliance with all applicable laws and the Code;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="8%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	providing for remedies, up to and including termination, for
	failure to comply with applicable laws or the Code;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="8%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	requiring Goldcorp&#146;s approval to engage sub-contractors and
	permitting Goldcorp to terminate such relationships if laws or the Code are
	violated.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	Always enforce remedies, including termination if appropriate, against agents,
	consultants, contractors or sub-contractors that breach any laws or the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="X60364EXV99W4_HTM_116">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Conflicts of Interest
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
